I’m trusting you to make the right calls about what this settlement really needs, [PlayerName]. For now, we can only support 3 specialized buildings...But I’m working on what we’ll need to support more later.

Improvements provide a huge boon to one of our Specialized Buildings, providing new and helpful services. But be warned. There are 2 possible improvements, and once you’ve built one, you can never change your mind. Choose wisely.
I’d like to spend a week helping with the construction tasks.
Really? You’re fine with spending 7 days helping us out? It’s much appreciated, [PlayerName]. Are you sure?
Funds are essential to the running of a city. We’ll need money to handle the construction of more delicate items. We can start by levying a tax on those with homes, as well as businesses.
Of course, if you’d like to donate your own silver or gold, we’d be happy to take it!
If we have a critical need for a certain kind of basic resource, let me know, and I can spend some of our funds in order to purchase some from another tribe.
What’s on the agenda today, [PlayerName]?
We need to buy some resources for the settlement.
I want to donate some funds to the city treasury.
Oy, it’s you! What can I get you?
I want to see your exotic goods.
I want to travel somewhere. - 300 Silver
Sure thing, where do you want to go?
Take me to Cierzo.
Take me to Berg.
Take me to Monsoon.
Take me to Levant.
Take me to Harmattan.
Cierzo’s sent along their catch of the day, get ‘em while they’re still fresh!
We’ve brought in some of the best that Berg has to offer this time!
Monsoon sent us some goods this time, in one of those fancy new Soroborean preservation wagons! Enjoy!
Levant’s sent along some of their finest luxuries this time, friend! Get them while you can!
We’ve got some finely crafted goods from Harmattan this time around! Take a look!
This may not be as impressive as my old Magma forge in Old Sirocco, but I’ll make do. What do you need worked on?
Craft me a weapon.
Craft me some armor.
Ah, want some experimental weaponry, eh? What do you need?
I have a set of Chalcedony Armor in mind for you. Interested?
Chalcedony Helmet – Nephrite Gemstone + 3 Chalcedony + 400 Silver
Chalcedony Armor – 2 Nephrite Gemstones + 5 Chalcedony + 600 Silver
Chalcedony Boots – Nephrite Gemstone + 3 Chalcedony + 300 Silver
Hailfrost Sword – Militia Sword + Cold Stone + 200 Silver
Hailfrost Mace – Militia Mace + Cold Stone + 200 Silver
Hailfrost Axe – Militia Axe + Cold Stone + 200 Silver
Hailfrost Claymore – Militia Claymore + Cold Stone + 300 Silver
Hailfrost Hammer – Militia Hammer + Cold Stone + 300 Silver
Hailfrost Greataxe – Militia Greataxe + Cold Stone + 300 Silver
Hailfrost Spear – Militia Spear + Cold Stone + 300 Silver
Hailfrost Halberd – Militia Halberd + Cold Stone + 300 Silver
Hailfrost Knuckles – Militia Knuckles + Cold Stone + 300 Silver
(DELETED)
Hailfrost Dagger – Militia Dagger + Cold Stone + 150 Silver
Hailfrost Pistol – Militia Pistol + Cold Stone + 150 Silver
(DELETED)
I want a one-handed weapon.
I want a two-handed weapon.
I want an off-hand weapon.
(Next set)
Experimental alchemy, at your service, [PlayerName]! Whether you need medicine, or want something to explode in your enemy’s face, I’ve got a remedy for what ails you!
Ah, there you are, [PlayerName]! I think you’ll enjoy our new permanent enchanting setup! There’s no fiddling with incense pillars required for this one!
Place a rare material from the Caldera in the incense pot, place the gear you’d like to enchant on the stone tablet, and we’ll take care of the rest for you!
And with that expanded library, now you’ll be able to enchant your off-hand weapons like dagger and shield and so on, as well!
Ah, my favourite customer! What do you want to treat yourself to?
Where’s there’s people in need, Sorobor visits with goods and supplies in hand! What do you need, my friend?
Welcome to the Raging Myrm! Pull up a seat and make yourself at home!
Want to stay the night? Then put 25 Silver on the counter!
Enjoy your stay!

Welcome to the Crucible of Fire! Wager some Silver, earn Conqueror Medals and exchange them for glorious prizes! Oh and we’re not responsible for your safety, if you get killed in there, that’s on you.
Sign me up for a fight!
I want to exchange my Conqueror Medals for a prize.
So, who do I sign you up to fight?
The Knights of Calixa.
The Masters of the Ocean.
The Guardians of the Marsh.
The Wolfgang Warriors.
The Champions of New Sirocco.
Hand over two Medals, and I’ll fill the Chest of Plenty over there for you. You might find almost anything in there, from the rarest treasure, to the lowliest scrap! Are you in?
I’ve filled the Chest for you, go take your reward!
You’re on [PlayerName]! Go get ‘em!
That opponent is recovering from the last fight. They’ll be up for another round sometime tomorrow.
Good fight! You’ve earned this!
I’ve mastered every kind of weapon worth using. If you want to unlock the ultimate secrets of war, you will find no better teacher.

If you’re here, it must mean you are considering specializing your talents. You can only go so far while keeping all options open. Sooner or later, you will need to commit to a style, and hone yourself to a razor’s edge!
Remember, once you have chosen a specialization, you cannot change your mind. Choose your training wisely, for each path comes with a drawback.
Elatt welcomes you, [PlayerName]. If you make a donation of 100 Silver for those in need, I will happily provide you with a boon of protection against all elements, that will last for two full days.

Elatt welcomes you, [PlayerName]. If you make a donation of 125 Silver for those in need, I will happily provide you with a boon of protection against all elements and further protection against negative statuses. The protection will last for two full days.
Elatt’s eye is on you, [PlayerName]. May he keep you safe in your travels! Feel free to return whenever you wish for Elatt’s protection to be extended.
Ancestors guide you, [PlayerName]. Thank you for setting up an outpost for the Krypteia out here. It will be a great boon to us.

Gabriella told me that you never had a chance to learn any of the abilities and skills the Krypteia have kept secret all these years. I think this one is a good place to start, it’s bailed me out of many close calls.
What are you doing out here?

I’ve been trying to track down a descendant of the Scarlet Lady that we uncovered through meticulous study of the Memories. There was a descendant that we killed decades ago, that the Memories suggest may have had an illegitimate child in Sirocco.

The trail stops dead there, though. I don’t know if he had a child with a Worker, or with one of the Nobles. And with the revolution that happened...Untangling that thread will be much harder than usual. Who knows, maybe my job was done for me.

I may be here for a few years. I want to be absolutely sure I eliminate the right people and ONLY the right people. Our job is to put an end to the Scarlet Lady, not to assassinate people for political reasons. We must be thorough, but merciful.
You feel pity for her descendants?

Absolutely. They didn’t ask to be born into the bloodline of a monster. But we can’t let them live. The Lady can speak into their minds, drive them to do things that benefit her. The only thing we can do is end their lives quickly and mercifully.
Is all this really necessary? There’s no way to make peace with her?
How does one make peace with an enemy who would only use that peace to prepare for further conflict? You cannot show mercy to a foe who has no intention of doing the same for you.
I’ve looked into the Memories, I’ve seen through their eyes what she is capable of. As much as these eliminations cause my heart to ache, I’ll do it if it’s the only way to stop her.
Ah, [PlayerName]! It’s good to see you!
Thanks to your help...Elatt’s will much more easily be able to focus on the Caldera region. I have no doubt he will reward you with a blessing in exchange for your continued hard work.
How’s Monsoon?

The Scourge did a considerable amount of damage...But repairs are coming along very nicely. The loss of the Cardinal, though... At least I know that his sacrifice was of critical importance, but it still stings terribly.
Kirouac said he had a little alchemy experiment for you to try out. He told me it’s perfectly safe, and should be of great use to you out here!
How are Calixa and Simeon holding up?

Calixa’s doing quite alright. She’s adjusting quite well to her new state. Simeon...He’s hurting. While having his wife present inside his head whenever he wishes is comforting, it’s no proper substitute for having her in his arms.
They’ll figure something out eventually, I’m certain. Love like theirs won’t be so easily broken.
Those Mana Chambers will be very useful to our research. In exchange, we’ll happily lace a unique enchantment into your body for free. Favors for favors!
How does that feel? Old Gregory said it would feel like a considerable improvement... By the way...There are a LOT of eyes on what you’re doing out here. Don’t let the Academy down, you hear?
(You have already taken your weekly share from this reservoir.)
Ahh, the Caldera. When my urges for violence become too much to bear, this region’s hostility is a safe outlet for them. Don’t fear for your safety, friend. My need is quite sated today.
You have found me at a time of plenty, friend. Take this little gift. I insist. You’ll find it more useful than I would.
I’m hungry.

We MUST have law and order in Sirocco once more! We cannot allow our pride and culture to be corrupted and abused by these petulant labourers! Our goods must continue to be made, trade must continue to flow!

Remember, the only reason you were elected to supervise those peasants is because we willed it so. Get this unrest under control, NOW! If they continue to undermine us, it could have dire ramifications on our reputation in the Blue Chamber!

You over-worry. No one could possibly know what you did with that crate of ballots. Magma tells no tales. And your Ambraine herb giveaway easily blunted the outrage when we announced the indefinite postponing of further elections. You’re in the clear, my friend.

I think that class traitor knows about our stockpile of Ambraine. She stalked me most of the way home. Destroy all of it, to be safe! If they realize we’re controlling the supply to keep them all in line, those ungrateful addicted parasites would riot!

You should have suppressed that Levant Engineer’s discovery. If any other city becomes capable of forging Tsar Stone or Damascene Steel without the use of Magma, our greatest advantage will be stolen from us! This is exactly WHY we can’t “move” our population!

I warned the Chamberlord. I told him that the hierarchy was fragile, and if the Merchants ever chose to side with the Workers, we would lose our hold over the city. I told him that even those who benefit from the way things are inevitably have a breaking point.

And now look where we are. Huddled in a twisted temple, serving the whims of a lich, our class outcast and our society overturned. Perhaps we deserve it, too. Our job was to ensure the city operated efficiently, and we allowed it to be destroyed by-
(The remainder of the page has been scorched by fire...)

I understand that we no longer need our Warriors to protect us, and that the Chamberlord fears they will betray us next. But killing them and replacing them by these monstrous minions of the Scarlet Lady? I worry...Will she deem us Nobles expendable nex-
You’re a pretty good engineer! Where did you learn all this?

Back when I was a bandit, I was the one who kept our essentials working. I made a primitive water filter and everything when I was a youth. After Dorion adopted me, he and Evangeline made sure I got the training I needed to refine my talents.
You used to be a bandit? You don’t seem like the type!
Outside of those fools who mistakenly think robbery is “easy money”, most “Bandits” reject that label. Anything larger than a small pack of people would likely call themselves “Independents”.
I was born into a nomadic clan whose primary hunting grounds was just beyond the edges of the Caldera, barely within the protective radius of the Vigil Pylon.
How did you end up engineer in a major city, then?

Our clan ran into disaster about 5 years ago. Disease. Our clan leader succumbed, and her replacement...She was cruel. Anyone displaying symptoms was cut down immediately. The group largely collapsed soon after.

And then, on a foraging trip, one of us accidentally woke a Gargoyle. As we tried to flee, I fell down a small ridge and broke my leg. My fellows left me behind, knowing that I would only slow them down.
If a forager from Sirocco hadn’t found me, a Torcrab likely would have put me out of my misery, and a Medyse would have used my corpse to incubate its eggs.

I am beyond thankful one of Dorion’s men rescued me. Despite their initial mistrust, I was happy to do whatever I could to repay these people. Dorion offering to make me his adopted son last year was an honor I still don’t feel worthy of.
So, how does civilization compare to the bandit life?

It’s nice not having to fear for my life every waking moment. It’s nice knowing that we all count on one another, and keep everyone alive. Even being a refugee trying to start over like this...It’s an improvement to life outside the walls.
Of course, I could do without the rigid class system the Nobility saddled us with. And I do miss many of my former companions. But overall, this life is much more stable.

I don’t blame many for choosing the life of an outlaw. Being true only to yourself and your crew, unbound by Blood Prices and restriction...It’s appealing to many. But the dangers are great. Not just to us, but those who we often have to prey upon just to survive.
Where’d you learn how to identify geological samples? That takes an education.

It does. My family was part of the Noble class when I was a child. As a result, I was fortunate enough to receive a comprehensive education, including natural sciences like medicine, botany and geology.
How’d you end up leading a revolt if you were a noble?!

My family used to own this quarry. One day when my parents were down one of the tunnels urging the workers to pick up the pace to meet quota...Someone accidentally made a hole into a magma flow. Only two people made it out alive. Father, and one of the workers.

The incident woke my father up. He realized most of Sirocco’s mining operations were unsafe, and pushed for ways to improve worker safety. The other Nobles, however, did not approve. No one would do business with us anymore.

Two years later, with no buyers for our goods, and immense pressure from up on high...Father sold the quarry and that was that. I may have spent my childhood as a noble, but as a young woman, I learned the plight of the workers firsthand.

Even so, Father was able to keep most of our old books, so I never stopped educating myself. Not only natural sciences, but politics and public speaking. Having seen both sides of our society, the injustice of it all was plain as day, and I wanted to change it.

The rise of Levant certainly helped. For generations, the Nobles told us that it was impossible to have better standards for the working class in a region so hostile. Seeing Levant succeed inspired us to demand more.
Levant didn’t win their freedom through bloody revolution, though.

I didn’t WANT a bloody coup, [PlayerName]. I helped Dorion try to start a worker’s union, and that was taken over by the nobles. I tried to get the Ambraine supply put in the hands of the Workers, I was accused of wanting to give drugs to children...
Ambraine is just an herb, right? Why is it so central to your city’s politics?

Amraine helps regulate body heat, and protects the lungs from the ash and soot in the air. It’s been an essential tool for anyone working in the Caldera for ages. Without it...We’d collapse in a matter of hours, doing the intense work that we do.

Of course, the Nobles knew that. They also knew about how if you become dependent on Ambraine and stop taking it...You’ll suffer from debilitating withdrawal symptoms. They leveraged their exclusive hold on the supply to try to keep us in line.

It wasn’t until the impending collapse of the city that Dorion, Josef and I started to get seriously aggressive about our demands. And even then, everything we did was denounced as dangerous and forcibly silenced under the martial law that the Nobles had imposed.

Fortunately, by the time of the collapse and the Nobles barred the doors to the worker’s district, leaving us to die...I’d managed to assemble a healthy supply of Pressure Plate Traps and Levantine Pistols for our mob of finally roused people.
How’d you manage to assemble an arsenal like that during martial law?!

I...I’ll be honest, [PlayerName], Father and I had been planning for this possibility for several years. But I refused to fire the first shot until I was sure we would win...Until at least the Merchants supported us...And well...We waited too long.
It kills me to know that we could have avoided this if we overthrew them sooner... *sigh* But it makes sense...People are easily cowed until their lives are on the line.
Here sleeps Big Al, father and guardian.
The others respect you quite a bit. How did you end up becoming their supplier?

I used to be a miner in my younger years. I only got where I am through mutual cooperation, daring to try new things, and more than a few very lucky breaks with a patron in the Merchant class. I’ve made certain to never forget my roots in manual labor.

For quite a while, I’ve been sort of the unofficial voice between the other Workers and the Nobility. I never wanted things to turn to violence, but they used every method imaginable to protect their control over the Ambraine and property from peaceful change.
So, what did you try to do?

Among other things, we tried to institute a Worker’s union, overseen by an official elected every year. I actually ran for the position myself, you know. I didn’t even ask for much, just some common-sense protections for the Workers.
I take it you didn’t win, then?

Any degree of change frightened the Nobles. I was labelled a radical, a madman. The nobles split the city against one another, twisted rules to suit them, and possibly even stole ballots...In the end, a Noble was elected to the position. He changed nothing.

The other Nobles decided that, as he was doing such a good job in their eyes, no further elections needed to be held. That was nearly 5 years ago. And then, even when we discovered the danger Old Sirocco was in, he refused to take action.
So, we held demonstrations. Nothing violent. We just did enough to slow all work to a crawl. We thought this would be enough to get their attention... Instead, it drove the Nobles into a fury.

They imposed martial law, confining our people to the lower districts, and unleashed their warriors on any who would not work or obey the curfew...And still, they refused to move the population from our doomed city.

In the end, the old saying was proven true. “Those who make peaceful change impossible, will find violent revolution inevitable”. This could have been prevented...But the Nobles refused to change course.
They were so afraid to lose even just some of their wealth and privilege, that they preferred to do nothing, and lost all of it anyway.
Only someone who has reached the pinnacle of their life may face the shadows of their past, and find peace and reflection within.

The people of Cierzo demand my exile. I do not blame them. My rigid faith in the Five Winds caused this disaster. My pride caused this slaughter. I should have opened my mind and heart to this new god and let him help us.

Leadership of what is left of Cierzo is being turned over to the Aberdeen family. They are worthy successors. Natasha Aberdeen is a prudent woman, and a dedicated member of the Krypteia. I can put my faith in her.
My heart aches for my daughter. With the rest of my bloodline slaughtered by the Scourge, she and her descendants will bear the full weight of my crimes for generations to come.

It is unfair to her that she must bear this Blood Price alone...But I know that without it, she would not live to see the next season. As much as it harms her, it also protects her from the vengeance of all those who have lost family.

As an exiled Chamberlady, I understand that I should not seek refuge within another tribe, nor seek a life of comfort. After what I did, there is only one possible redemption for me, one way I can ease the burden on my bloodline.

This...Elatt...He told me that the Scourge are not infinite. If we can slay even a few, then we will have saved many lives. I will take my two guards with me, and we will find the source of the Scourge hordes. And we will fight them to our last breath.

We will find their source, and we will establish a line of defense that can help us contain the threat. I can only hope this lessens our bloodline’s shame and the Blood Price my actions have shackled them with...
I heard from Zephyrien's killer in Levant, that Sirocco arranged for his death. Which of the Nobles was responsible?
I heard from your former Chamberlord that your people were responsible for Zephyrien’s murder. I want the truth, Evangeline.

I...I have to come clean, [PlayerName]. Zephyrien's death...It was my Father's fault. My fault. I should have stopped him, but...We were in an impossible situation, and he believed it was the only way out...

Our Nobles sold much of our territory to the Chamberlord of Monsoon. Territory we knew that we desperately needed in order to resettle our people before the city collapsed. But Damian Lockwell refused to come to a reasonable arrangement.

So we reached out to Zephyrien. He came from a worker family, did you know? We’d been proud to see one of us join the Holy Mission, and then rise to the rank of Champion. We thought that if anyone would be willing to help, it would be him.

Zephyrien told us that he could not compromise the neutrality of the Holy Mission. Several times we wrote to him, begging his aid, but all he could do was promise that he would come help us himself “someday”.

As the collapse of the city became imminent, Father warned him that if nothing changed, we might soon have no choice but to use force to overthrow the Nobles in order to save our city, or take some other drastic action to secure new lands.

Zephyrien wrote back that any form of violent uprising was unjustifiable, and that if we dared to try, he would come bring us to justice. He brushed aside our desperation and imminent doom and threatened us, the victims.

The bastard also warned the Nobles, who immediately imposed martial law. The few rights we still had were violently ripped away. Any possibility of revolt was squashed. And still, they would not do anything about the impending collapse.
With the city on the verge of destruction and the Nobles making escape impossible, we could not wait any longer. So...Father made a deal with Prince Pietro of Levant.

The Prince wanted a war with the Blue Chamber, and the crown of Levant for himself. In exchange for our help, he offered half the territory taken in the war, as well as the ousting of our Nobles as soon as he could spare the troops for it.

But Father knew that if we assisted the Prince’s plan to commit cold-blooded murder at a council meeting, in the Blue Chamber itself...Zephyrien would realize what we had done, and would bring down the wrath of a god on us.

Father spent the last of our money to hire a Dean from Sorobor Academy to arrange for two Tsar Bullets to be loaded with the strongest distilled Scourge Blood he could acquire, then deliver it to the Prince.

With his help, Father arranged for a Council Meeting under the false pretense that the Sirocco Chamberlord would be there to negotiate for Monsoon’s land, knowing Zephyrien would absolutely want to be there to put an end to this mess.
Father isolated him by having a message slipped to him, claiming to have taken our Chamberlord and his entourage hostage in a cave in Enmerkar. And Levant...Took care of the rest.

I didn’t want us to go ahead with this plan... But with Zephyrien threatening us, and our city about to crumble... It seemed to be the only way to save our city. In the end... The collapse and revolution happened anyway, and Father paid the price for it.
Where’s your father now?

He’s dead. The nobles convicted him of treason and murder, then exiled him into the Caldera as punishment. And then, they shackled my bloodline with a thousand silver Blood Price and chained me to my post in the forges.

I...Found what was left of Father on our migration to this quarry. A Gargoyle petrified him months ago. By then, the spell had fully turned his internal organs to stone. There's...No coming back from that.
I know that I can’t ever make up for what my Father did. I know I should have done more to stop him...But...We were desperate for any way out of our situation. Any price felt worth it at the time.
You're lucky I swore to live by our 3 Pillars. Otherwise, this would be the end of our help for your people.
I understand. I hate this, and I hate him. But I understand why he did it. We should have helped you before things got that desperate.
(Say nothing and walk away)
I heard from your former Chamberlord that your father was responsible for pushing Levant into war. Care to explain?
I...I have to come clean, [PlayerName]. The war that Prince Pietro and Cyrene started...It was my father's fault. My fault. I should have stopped him, but...I believed it was our only leverage.
If Calixa had died and Levant had fallen, this would be the end of our help towards your people.
...I understand. Some of our own people were driven to terrible things too. Pietro bears a lot of the blame for this as well.
I...Thank you, [PlayerName]. I won’t forget your forgiveness.
(The Calygrey growls and pounds his fists, then points excitedly at the arena. He doesn’t appear immediately hostile.)
(The paintings on the wall show images of Calygreys fighting...Perhaps if you fight here, they will offer you a reward?)
(Gesture that you want to fight!)
(The Calygrey thuds his staff on the ground, and soft magical flames appear at the center of the arena, marking the zone of combat. Your foes are ready...Are you?)
(The Calygrey lets out a loud purr, and playfully shoves you. It would seem that there are no more foes left to fight. Perhaps you should return at a later time...)

If you wish to study a form of magic that does not ask you to sacrifice your very essence to a Ley Line...Sit down, and listen well, traveller. Open your mind to the primal beating heart of the wilds!
Make me a Ghost Drum.
Make me Sky Chimes.
Have you brought me a Hexa Stone, a Ghost’s Eye and two pieces of Palladium to make one?
Have you brought me a Rainbow Peach Seed, an Occult Remains and two pieces of Palladium to make one?
May it guard your life, and bring low your foes!
Only someone who has had Ethereal Dreams may perceive this foe...
Perhaps a sacrifice of Petrified Organs, Chromium Shards and Voltaic Vines will complete this statue...
Perhaps a sacrifice of 2 Vagabond Gelatin will do something here...
Perhaps a sacrifice of 8 Blue Sand will permit you to challenge the regrets of your bloodline...
(You feel a strange surge of wind blow through you. The Wind in the Caldera region recognizes you and will obey you if you command it)
A strange whispering Vortex splits the air here, showing shifting mirages...It seems unwise to touch this without the appropriate tool...

A strange whispering Vortex splits the air here, showing shifting mirages...Your Experimental Chakram sparks with greater energy than before...And it pulls you into the Vortex, through a void filled with flickering stars!

With a burst of power, the Vortex of shifting stars dissipates, and you briefly hear a wail of despair...The Experimental Chakram roars to life with newfound power, a smaller Vortex at its center! One final time, it hurls you through the mysterious void...
As you place the Warm Axe in the Charging Station you suddenly see it begin to glow! It focuses the heat of the Volcano into the Axe, until it sizzles with new power!

Lines of glowing white, yellow and magenta energy spiral through the fossils of this Calygrey Altar, humming a repeating melody...If you had some ambient power yourself and something that could mimic the melody it emits...Perhaps you could use this for something...

You play the Fossilized Greataxe trying to match the pattern...With a shudder, you feel the weapon tap into your Boons and draw their power into itself...A moment later, the Calygrey magic has restored the Greataxe to perfection!
Halloo there, small human! You keep your sharp steel in your bag, and give me shiny Silver, and you will get very nice goods!
Say...Do you think you could fix the silk banner on this fancy Halberd of mine?

Hmmm...Au! This is made of Ash Silk! Yes, I can fix it...IF you do something for us! There are exiled Ashborn out there, who causing great harm to innocents. You bring 3 of their Garnet Hearts to me, and then will I fix your banner, understand?
I have what you asked for!
Hmm...Good, give me a moment...
It is done! This is a very special weapon, little human! You treat it with more respect than the last owner, you understand me?
The tools of this smithy are still in good shape and no one is around to question you! You easily smash open the lock on the Smelly Sealed Box and retrieve the contents!
Au, a small one! I hope you enjoy steam bath too! It is a great place for me to think! As student of our Highmonk, he have much to teach me. Too much, I think...
Does this weird mace mean anything to you? I think it’s sealed with Giant Language...

Hmm...I think I can open this for you! ...Au....AU! Belonged to a cruel man, this did! One who used Giant’s Blood for horrible things! I should not have opened this...You go throw this weapon into the nearest ocean, human, if you have any sense!
The rusted spear’s rust cracks open with a horrifying shriek, revealing its true form!
Looks like the Ancient Dwellers got this poor Ash Giant...His body is coated with Petrified Stone Dust...
Your Slumbering Shield opens its mouth and gasps, sucking in the Petrified Dust that clings to you and the Giant! With a soft moan, it opens its eyes, revealing its true power!
There are holes in this statue, with red light shining from it...Perhaps you could repair it with an Amethyst Geode, a Voltaic Vine, and Petrified Organs...
(Insert the missing parts)
East road: Old Quarry South road: Sirocco City
East road: New Sirocco City South road: Old Sirocco Ruins
The Caldera will eat you alive if you’re unprepared, stranger. If you need anything, I’m sure we can settle on a fair price.
Au, another tired little bug! You need rest? You give me 50 Silver, and you can sleep here. We have very fancy beds, made by desert people! You like?
My hands are full with important matters, missionary. Ellinara will give you work from now on.
Blessings of Elatt upon you, [PlayerName]. It's time for your first mission.

Before I give you your first mission, I want you to understand the lengths we must go to oppose the Scourge. Burn greasy fern at the altar on the hill next to the Vigil Crystal just outside Monsoon, and tell me what you see.
Before you go I need you to understand the lengths we go to to protect Aurai from the Scourge. Have you ever seen one of the Vigils before?
Those are the giant crystal tower things, right? The ones that protect us from the Scourge?

Yes, exactly. There's one not far from Monsoon. I want you to go there and burn a Greasy Fern at the altar atop the hill beside it. Breathe it in, and then tell me what you see there. Only then will you be ready for your first mission.
If you don't have any Greasy Fern with you, the alchemist should have some for sale.
Yes, [PlayerName]?
I burnt Greasy Fern at the Vigil's altar.
And what did you see?
Spirits, trapped with a Scourge Beast in the crystal, stabbing it endlessly.
I saw why the Vigils work. It was... painful to look at.
I don't want to talk about it.
And what did you learn?
Sometimes, victory comes with great sacrifice.
Indeed. Now you know why Elatt doesn't celebrate his victory against the Scourge. It came at grave cost.
Sometimes you have to do terrible things if you want to survive.
Sometimes. But they are to be avoided at all costs. Or else we become the very monsters we fight against.
Even gods make mistakes.
Perhaps. Now you see why Elatt fights the Scourge as much as he can. Should we someday eradicate them, it will mean an end to the suffering of those spirits.
The Vigils are a necessary evil. Until the Scourge is purged from Aurai, those spirits keep us safe. They are a grim reminder of the evil we face, and our sworn mission.
We can't depend on the Vigils and our warriors to defend us from the Scourge forever. We must find a way to free Aurai from them, permanently.
I understand. Whatever it takes.
Then we'd better hurry and get that done. The sooner we can free those spirits, the better.
Oliele said much the same, although I can tell this revelation hurt her deeply.
On that note, I have work for you. I sent Oliele on a mission before you left for the Vigil, and I would feel better if you joined her. Something about it sends chills up my spine.
Are you familiar with the Montcalm tribe in the Chersonese?
Those lunatics who string up the corpses of their enemies all around their village? Yeah, I've heard about them. They've been hostile to Cierzo for years.
They've been turning to the undead from the valley beyond the Ghost Pass for protection. While this is itself worrisome, things have taken a turn for the worse.
Elatt can sense a huge growth of Corruption erupting underground. Whatever is down there has become dangerously tainted. It must be cleansed before it becomes a serious threat to the Chersonese.
Go beyond the Ghost Pass in the Chersonese, delve deep underground in the valley beyond it, and find the source of the Corruption. Cleanse it by any means necessary.
I’m here to report on the mission. We purified the altar. The Corruption under the Chersonese is back under control.
Good work, [PlayerName]. Where's Oliele?
She'll be back soon. She needs time. She… Elatt saved her life by removing the corruption in her, replacing her limbs with pure light.
Elatt's name… I understand. Something that drastic will take its toll, even on the most faithful believers. For a new missionary… I don't blame her for needing some time.
You're free for now, [PlayerName]. I'll let you know when we need you again.
Take your time getting familiar with the Marsh, [PlayerName]. You'll get your first task soon enough. Prepare yourself. In a few days and I will have something for you.
I’m waiting on a delivery of Livweedi, sorry. I can’t chat until it arrives. It’s important.
I'm a busy man! Unless you have something important to say to me, I have no time for anyone who serves that freak in the temple.
Oh...[PlayerName]… I can’t really talk now. I… I have a mission to prepare for. I’ll see you.
Hey, if Ellinara asks you to… Never mind… Forget I said anything.
Oh. Hi. I guess it's only natural they'd send you here too.
What are you doing here, Oliele?
I just... wanted to come back here before leaving for my first mission. Ellinara told you to burn Greasy Fern here too, didn't she? Tell me what you see.
[PlayerName]... Did you see it? Those poor spirits... They'll never rest in peace.
That's horrifying.
No wonder the Scourge don't go anywhere near the Vigils.
I knew Elatt was only the god of discipline, not the force that created all of Aurai... But seeing this... What IS Elatt? How can he allow this? What did I choose to become part of?
You're having doubts about joining the Holy Mission?
Aren't you? After seeing this? Those spirits are trapped in that crystal forever, their only purpose for all eternity is to torture that Scourge Beast...
Well, it's an effective Scourge repellent, that's for sure.
How can you so easily justify this?! Those people's spirits are in torment, [PlayerName]! What if it was your parents trapped in that crystal?
Oliele, without the Vigils, the Scourge Beasts could attack our homes, our families. They're ravenous evil monsters. Would you take that chance?
You're right. I wouldn't. But still... This sacrifice is horrible...
We can't doubt Elatt. If he did this, it's because it had to be done.
He was human once... He may still be capable of human error. Is this really the best solution, or is it just a desperate plan that no one has bothered to question?
I'm having doubts too...
So it's not just me... I know Elatt isn't the answer to everything. But when I pledged myself to him, I believed he truly wanted nothing more than to protect others... Now I'm not so sure...
This does protect us, though. It keeps the Scourge Beasts away from us.
At what price...There must be a better way…
All we can do is trust in Elatt…
I... I suppose...I can only keep on hoping that this cruelty was necessary.
Either way, the fact remains that we need to destroy the Scourge once and for all. These poor spirits deserve to finally rest in peace.
I'm off. Ellinara gave me a task to perform and I intend to see that it's carried out. I'll be seeing you, [PlayerName].
Oh! [PlayerName]! I wasn't expecting you! I guess Ellinara sent you to check on me?
Yes. She said something about this mission sent chills up her spine.
I'm fine, [PlayerName]. I'm not a child who needs supervision. Still, thanks for coming. A friendly face is always welcome.
I thought you might appreciate some backup.
I do. I’m not sure what has me more on edge. The undead hiding in the shadows, or being so close to a hostile tribe that would kill us on sight…

The undead in this area bind their memories to an ancestral altar past this door. That's where the source of the Corruption is. But they've locked the door with some kind of spell. It's taking me forever to remove it...
Maybe something in the cave is keeping the spell active?
Maybe. Can I ask you to go look for it? Maybe if I keep casting counter-spells on this door, I'll manage to break through and we can get in, regardless.
Ugh. Whoever sealed this door had an inhuman amount of time on their hands!
The spell on the door just faded without warning. That was your doing, I suppose?
I killed the undead that was keeping it closed, yeah. What's the situation here?
Umm… So that skeleton came up and said you sent him to open up the door...What happened?
He's been trying to keep the undead here in check. He's trying to help.
I'm going to trust your judgment on this one. Most people would have finished him off purely on reflex. You're really something.
What's the situation down here?
We still have time before the damage is permanent. I'll try to purify this altar. Ellinara taught me the spell she uses for work like this.

Most of the memories that the ghosts have placed in this altar have been consumed by the Corruption. The ghosts are so far gone that they don't want to be purified. They're preventing me from even touching the altar.
We have to do something. It's only a matter of time before they're beyond saving.
I have an idea. It's insane, but I can't think of anything else. [PlayerName], I need you to pour some of your life into this altar. It'll pacify the ghosts while I cast the spell to cleanse it.
You want me to give up some of my life to these things? Have you lost your mind?!

They're desperately addicted to fresh life now. They'll only drop their defenses if there's something to feed on. The spell will take all of my concentration, so it has to be someone else who makes the sacrifice…
(You feel the the Altar suck at your very spirit the moment you approach... )
(Give up Health)
(Give up Stamina)
(Give up Strength)
(Give up Endurance)
(Agony rips through you as the Ghosts greedily feed on your very essence! All you can do is trust Oliele.)
(Oliele's eyes are red bleeding voids, her arms covered in quivering red lumps, her veins green and glowing...)
(A burst of light floods the room. As it fades Oliele stands before you, her eyes and arms replaced with pure light)
What... Elatt... What did you do to me?
Oliele! What happened to you?
The Corruption lashed back against me! I thought I was going to die... My eyes... My arms... I felt them get consumed…
Elatt told me it wasn't my time... He saved me. I think he replaced whatever the Corruption took with light. But what have I become?
You're still you, Oliele, just with body parts made of light.
Y-you say that like it's no big deal! I've lost parts of my body!
Think of the new limbs like a crutch. A crutch that makes you stronger, rather than slowing you down.
I... You're right. I shouldn't worry. Elatt saved me. That's all that matters. He wouldn't save me if he had malicious intent... I hope.
You have body parts crafted by a literal god, Oliele. You should be excited!
I can't just casually shrug this off! My eyes... They're not mine anymore... How can I trust what I see if they're not my own eyes?
I don't know, but it looks powerful. That's an amazing blessing he gave you.
Look at me! I'm... I'm not me anymore! What did he do to me?
Thanks, [PlayerName]. It's going to take time to accept this... But I guess the only thing I can do is keep moving forward.
Does Elatt know my doubts? Did he save me regardless? Will he take these away if I question him? I... I don't know anymore. The only thing I can do is just... keep moving forward, I guess.
Is the altar taken care of? It's still stuck in that mass of Corruption.
Yes, I've purified the Corruption afflicting the altar. That fleshy mass is no longer malignant. We've averted the crisis for now.
What about when the Corruption builds up again?
I don't know. I don't think we can solve that problem... I only hope Ellinara or Elatt can think of something...
I'm… going to go back to Monsoon, [PlayerName]. I'll see you there… whenever I get there. I need time. Time to get used to… the new me, I guess.
I want to be alone, [PlayerName]. I need time. Time to get used to… the new me, I guess.
I’m going to need you to lay your hands on the altar and focus your thoughts on it. If both of us work on it it’s far more likely that things will go smoothly.
Alright, I’ll start the spell. Stand back, [PlayerName]. Far back. There’s no telling what the Corruption will do once the spell hits it.
Please, [PlayerName]. Unless we get the ghosts to lower their guard, I can’t purify the altar. You’ll have to pour some of your own life into it. It’s the only way.
Looks like the only thing I can do is… keep moving forward.
(Sorrow and pain, and a sense of duty linger around this altar)
(Burn a Greasy Fern on the altar)
(As you breathe in the aroma of the Greasy Fern, the memories of the buried ancestors floods your mind with vicious images.)

(You see an army of warriors fighting a massive Scourge Beast with spears… They are nearly wiped out, before one of them manages to cripple the beast. A ray of light falls from the sky and engulfs the monster, and it is trapped within shining crystal, surrounded by the dozens of people it killed.)

(As the memories fade and you return to your senses, you look up at the Vigil crystal and briefly see a swarm of ghosts trapped within the crystal with the Scourge Beast, endlessly stabbing it with their ghostly weapons.)

(You sense agony rippling from the crystal... The Scourge Beast within is still alive, endlessly tortured by the spirits of those it killed, the monster's pain a warning to keep other Scourge Beasts far, far away from Monsoon...)
(Leave)
Hoy! You! Yes, YOU! Fleshbag! Over here! The boxes on the side! Check the boxes on the side!
Finally! Hoy there! Name's Myriade! Sorry, as you can see, I've kin’of fallen to pieces.
A talking skull. Now I've seen everything.
You're telling me! Fleshy people haven't been down here in ages!
You have spoken your last, monster!
Oy oy! Monster? I ain’t a monster! Jus’ a pile of bones trying to get by! I ain’t no threat to nobody!
I'm the one who used to "lead" this merry band of undead cretins. And then the others got mad when I said not to eat the tasty offerings the living folk left outside...

So the other undead tore me apart and stuffed my pieces all over the darn cave. If I could jus’ get to the old altar, I’d get ’em back in line… If you can put me back together, I’ll open the path there again.

I put a spell to seal the door, to try to keep anythin’ nasty from coming out. The only way I can lift it is if I get in front of that door to undo the spell. Well, either that or I finally shuffle off this mortal coil.
One thing at a time. First, tell me what's going on here before I decide to put you back together!
Alright alright! There was a lot of blood spilled in the old fort. The victims jus’ couldn’t go to the afterlife. It caused a lot of Corruption to spill out, you know?

I gave those victims a home here, where they can live the lives that were stolen from them. There's an ancestral altar they can tether their memories to, so they can remember who they were when they were alive.
There's also plenty of Corruption to feed on, to cope with the hunger for life. It's not great, but it's enough to keep us sane.
Then, those living people out there started stringing up dying people as tribute and my ghost pals stopped feedin’ on the Corruption, preferring fresh tasty dying life.

But using Corruption as food is like milking a deer. If you don't milk it often enough, it'll just build up until you have a major problem. The Corruption has burst all over the Altar now, and it's destroying the memories we've stored within.
If it's not dealt with, those ghosts will lose what little humanity they have left! Then they'll just devour everything around, including the living who've been feeding them so nicely.
Alright, I’ll help you.
Wha? Just like that? You're not curious about the old talking skeleton?
Not really. I just want to get this mess fixed.
Not curious about the spooky, scary skeleton, and jus’ wants to help a fella! I like you, fleshbag!
Actually, I do want to know what's going on down here.
So I can just bash your skull in and the door opens up?
Hoy! You’re not seriously thinking about actually bashing my skull to pieces, are ya?!
You're an undead. A life-eating monster. I'm doing Aurai a favor! (Smash the skull)
Hoy, wait a minute! You're pulling my bone, right?!
(Despite the skull's protestations, you break it to pieces in one strike. A rush of mana pours out. The spell sealing the door to the Altar should be lifted)
No, I'm just considering the possibility.
Un-consider it! Un-consider it! This half-life isn't too much, but it's all I've got!
Sure, I'll help. Do you have any idea where to look for your body parts?
Now I'm more tempted than ever to smash you and move on with my life.
Lemme feel for 'em...
Ok, my torso feels like it's propped up on something, in a lit up area... Feels like there's minecart tracks nearby... If you can bring my skull there, I can probably feel for the other parts.
(You pick up the skull and take it with you.)
Ah, there we go! Already better! Let's feel for the others now...
Hoy there, need me to feel for the rest of my body parts?
Yes, where are they?
No, I'm fine.
(Smash Myriade's skull and open the barrier to the altar)
One arm feels like there's a campfire not far away... If I really stretch it... There's crystalized Mana nearby...
One arm feels like it's someplace kinda high up... If I really stretch it... There's the sound of little things scurrying not too far away.
My missing leg feels like it's someplace low and open... If I really stretch it... There's water nearby with something swimming in it.
(A badly cracked bone lies here... Whoever this belonged to must have died horribly.)
(The arm waves at you. Clearly this belongs to Myriade.)
(The leg stretches, as if to say "Here I am". This has to be Myriade's.)
(The torso hops a little, presenting the neck stump... This has to be Myriade's.)
I brought back your... hmm... bones.
Great, time to pull myself back together!
Ah, it's great to be in one piece again! Thanks for giving us a hand! ... And a leg and a ribcage!
Funny guy. Now open that door, would you?
I'll pretend I didn't hear that. Where's the Altar we need to work on?
It's in the frozen cave back near the entrance. It should be near the bottom of the ramp, where that nasty old Wendigo set up camp. I'll see you there!
(Myriade takes off at inhuman speed, his bones cracking loudly as he fades into the darkness...)
Things have gotten really bad while I was in pieces. The altar we’ve bound our memories to is smothered by the Corruption. It’s too much for me to eat away without losin’ my mind.
I really hope your lady friend there knows what she's doing. Corruption this thick takes on a life of its own.
I can help if you need me to. They'll tear what's left of my spirit to shreds, but it’ll distract ‘em for a bit. If it prevents you from ending up like ol’ Myriade, I'll do it.
No way. We need you in order to get these ghosts in order when we're done.
Well, that's true... I hope you can handle it, fleshy guy.
Yes, help me.
Well, here goes nothing...
Hah, thank you. It was a JOINT effort! Eh? Ehhh?
Har har, you're killing me, Myriade.
Stop! One more bad joke and I'll take you apart again!
You ain’t no fun. I'll keep my fellow undead on a tight leash from now on. I won't let them forget what they almost became.

Anyone who goes to nibble on tasty Montcalm Tribe tribute treats are no longer welcome to bind their memories here. I'm sure that threat will keep them from going bad again. A place where memories can stick is hard to come by.
Thanks again for your help. We're taking care to eat away at the Corruption regularly. It won't be a problem again, I promise!
I'll be back with your missing parts.
So, any luck?
(Take Myriade’s body part)
(Leave it be)
I. Ow. Mind. Memory. Can't. Think.
(The blast of Corruption from the altar seems to have stunned Myriade. You should give him a moment to recover.)
(You feel the warmth of a campfire fill you… Elatt speaks in your mind)
Well done, [PlayerName]! You brought peace to the tormented spirits under the Chersonese and established future safeguards for that region's safety.
At what cost, though?
What happened to Oliele?
As Oliele purified the altar, the Corruption clung to her. It would have left her an agonized husk of flesh. I did the only thing I could for her…
Replacing her lost body parts with light is an extreme measure. She will bear those scars, and my blessing for the rest of her days. They are a part of her now.

The job is done, [PlayerName]. I fear that without proper care, the Corruption will only grow again under the Chersonese. I will have to think very long about how to resolve it... Even so, you did your duty.
You deserve a reward for your trials. I will grant a blessing to you.
Thank you for your blessing. I'll make good use of it.
(You feel warmth flood your body. You are filled with new strength)
Give Oliele the blessing instead. I think she'll need it more than I will.
Are you certain?
Yes, give it to her.
You are exceptionally kind, [PlayerName]. It is done. She is grateful.
Carry on, missionary. Continue your good work.
(The altar pulses with Corruption. You can feel the emotions within being tainted with the mindless desire to consume…)
Let’s get to work, then.
I’m not ready for this, I need a minute.
(You lay your hands on the Altar and focus as Oliele does her work. You can feel the memories begin to fill with rage...)

If you ever find yourself facing ghosts, some Spiritual Varnish will make things a lot easier. Even someone as tough as me uses them when facing down the undead. No point taking needless risks, right?
Ah, there you are! I have an assignment for you.
Chamberlords of the Blue Chamber are headed to Berg for a council meeting. One of the topics of discussion involves us. We need a presence there.

The tribes of Sirocco want to migrate most of their population to the Hallowed Marsh. Volcanic eruptions have put their primary settlement, Caldera, in grave danger. They're demanding we give up half our land so they can settle here.
Half the marsh? That sounds unreasonable.
Obviously we would like to come to a fair arrangement, but Sirroco are being highly aggressive in their demands, and Damian Lockwell is rejecting the discussion completely. Things may get heated.
I've already sent Zephyrien and Oliele to Berg to watch over our representative, Mathias. I'd feel safer if you went as well.
Go to the Enmerkar forest, and make your way to Berg. There, look for the largest building, the Blue Chamber itself. Zephyrien will brief you when you get there.
[PlayerName], thank Elatt you're back! When news reached me that Levant attacked Berg and that Zephyrien was killed, I feared the worst.
Wait, Zephyrien is dead?
Yes, Cardinal Bourlamaque announced it yesterday. He didn’t give me any details... this is a terrible blow against the Holy Mission...
The Cardinal announced that Zephyrien was killed, but didn’t give any details. What happened to him? Oliele said that he’d gone missing and you went to look for him.
He was being consumed by Corruption from a poisoned bullet by the time I found him. Even Elatt couldn't save him.
Elatt's breath, why? Why would someone do this? I don’t want to believe Sirocco would stoop so low, but I don’t see anyone else with motive to attack the Holy Mission.

Things aren't well here in Monsoon either... Oliele was arrested as soon as she returned here. Lockwell has her locked up in a room in his home. Details are thin at the moment, but he's accused her of murder.
Oliele, a murderer? I doubt that very much.
That seems suspicious.
I knew she was trouble.

His refusal to speak with us about it is even more stern than usual. With the news that Zephyrien was assassinated... I have to wonder if Oliele's imprisonment is another move against the Holy Mission.

You knew Oliele from when she was in Cierzo. You can use that to make Lockwell listen to you. Speak to him not as a member of the Holy Mission, but rather as a concerned friend and maybe you can reach him.
Oliele is gone. Lockwell refuses to say anything.

This is serious trouble. The Cardinal asked Elatt to look for her, and even he can't find her. Her location is shielded from his sight, probably by Lockwell's magic. All we can be sure of is that she has not left the Hallowed Marsh region.
If she's not in Lockwell's house, and he refuses to say anything, you'll have to ask around, see if anyone has seen anything.
What news, [PlayerName]?
I got Oliele out. She's running away to Abrassar for a while.
That may be for the best. Even if you managed to resolve things with Lockwell, I wouldn't trust the man's word at this point. Thank you for looking out for her.
Nothing yet. I’ll let you know.

Some more of our people went missing in the swamp. I’m aware that there is an active bandit gang along the Pilgrim Road, but with this latest disappearance... I fear it may be something more sinister…
Do you think you could look into it? Mofat would be able to tell you more. He’s the old man in the pointed straw hat in the residential district. He's friends with one of the missing people.
I’ll look into it.
Any news about Oliele?
I haven’t heard anything from Oliele yet. I’ll let you know the moment she sends word, [PlayerName].
I heard about how you handled yourself in that cave of undead. Keep this up and you’re in danger of earning my respect, missionary!
[PlayerName]? Is that you? Dammit, I can barely see your face... my vision's going all blurry. I'm sorry you have to see me like this.
What happened?

It was a trap, like I thought. There weren't any hostages, just a bunch of guys with swords. As the fight began... Something hit me in the back... It blasted right through my armor... Sounded like one of Levant's firearms.
Whatever I was hit with is paralyzing me, I can barely move a muscle…If Elatt's blessing didn't shield me from pain, I don't know if I'd be conscious.
Zephyrien, the entire area around the bullet hole is covered with throbbing red lumps. There's glowing green veins in them too.

Corruption? My body should be able to resist it... Half my body is made of Elatt's light. Why isn't that enough to stop it? Hey, can you check my left arm? It's one made of light. What does it look like? How is it holding up?
Elatt's name. It's rotting. The light itself is crumbling away.
Elatt damn it all. What did that bastard woman hit me with?!
Who did it?
I don't know who she was. I could tell it was a woman with a shield, but she ran away too fast for me to see...And then the paralyzing dose kicked in and I couldn't get up to follow.
You have to report this! Get back to Monsoon. Tell Ellinara. Someone’s making a move on the Holy Mission. Tell Soeran... Tell him I'm sorry. Tell him to watch his back.
I need to get you help.

No. If I'm actually being consumed by Corruption, and even Elatt can't stop it, there's no hope for me. Do you know what happens if the Corruption really gets you? If you're lucky, it's a slow death as it overtakes your entire body.
If you're unlucky... You survive and end up some quivering monstrous mass of tumors and ooze. I'm a dead man either way. I’d rather die than become twisted into something monstrous like that.
Elatt... Let me go. If you can't save me, don't waste your energy. Just... make it quick...
(Zephyrien's eyes glow for a moment, then he goes completely still. The oozing lumps stop throbbing and immediately begin to rot away).
(The corrupting rot has eaten most of Zephyrien's body. The Candle Armor itself is ruined. But there's something metal shining in the mass of twisted rotting flesh...)
(Pull it out)
(Leave it be)

(With great care, you pull it out. It's a sharp spike made of gemstone, with a glass bulb at the other end. Dark, thick liquid clings to the glass. It appears to be some kind of armor piercing poison bullet.)
Hey, [PlayerName]. Zephyrien and I are on our way to Berg for a major council meeting. I wonder... Their archives are very detailed. Do they have books on Elatt’s human past, you think?
Thank you, [PlayerName]. I was worried things would get a lot worse.
You have no idea how welcome your face is, [PlayerName]. I couldn't have made it out of that mess alone.
Are you hurt?
No, thank Elatt. But I'm sure they were planning to.
[PlayerName]? No. No, I'm just hallucinating...
Oliele, it's me! Wake up!
Really? I'm not... imagining this?
They drugged me with something. They tried to question me... I fought back... They used fire from through the bars... And steel... And...
Dammit, I'm sorry I didn't get here sooner.
I need... water... Clean water...
Ugh... My head is still pounding...
Are you better now? Can you think straight?
I think... I’ll be alright... Most of my torture was done to my arms... This light heals quickly. I think I'll be ok, eventually... I hope.
What happened?

I... I found something in the Berg Archives. I've always been taught that Elatt came from the Hallowed Marsh... He's actually from Abrassar. His family was from Old Levant. They were in very deep with the Cabal of Winds.
His ascension and the arrival of the Scourge... They were nearly at the same time. I think there may be a connection between Elatt and the Scourge and the Cabal of Winds.
I have to wonder if Elatt himself was the source of the Scourge. Is he even the same man he was before his Ascension? Or is he something else who took the man’s name?
I was speaking with some friends about it. Then, one of the older disciples attacked us. He said it was heresy to question Elatt's divinity.
I tried to defend my friends... I picked him up and threw him at a wall. These arms of light are strong. Too strong. I broke his neck. It was an accident, I swear!
I'm going to the Abrassar desert. I don't feel safe going back to Monsoon. Not with Lockwell and... Elatt there. I need to dig up more of Elatt's past…and maybe the truth…
If you think you need to, go ahead. Let me know if you find the truth you’re looking for.
After revelations like that, I understand. That makes me wonder, too.
What about your duty to Aurai? People are going to die in the coming war. Now is not the time to go digging into Elatt’s past!
Well...I guess this is goodbye for now, [PlayerName]. I hope we meet again before long.
I’ll let you know what I find when I come back. Thank you.
I can’t keep working under Elatt’s name with these questions hanging over me. I have to go. Tell Ellinara for me.
Oh! This is a surprise. I’m still looking, [PlayerName]. I’ll let you know when I have a promising lead.
[PlayerName]? Thank Elatt. There’s been an attack. Some mercenaries from Levant used a bomb to blow their way into the Blue Chamber from the archives room below!
They took hostages and killed an ambassador in front of everyone! Sagard Battleborn just convinced the rest of the Chamberlords to declare war on Levant in retaliation!
I wish Elinara had sent me sooner. She had a feeling something might happen.
It gets worse. Just before the explosion happened, Zephyrien ran off. He said something about hearing that Sirocco’s Chamberlord had been kidnapped. He’s been missing for 3 days now!
What do we do? Someone has to bring this information back to Monsoon!
I know. I was going to go back myself, but someone needs to look for Zephyrien. I’m sure something has happened to him...
Can I ask you to go look for him, [PlayerName]? I’m a fast runner, I probably can make it back to Monsoon with this news faster than you.
Where should I start looking?
I think I heard Zephyrien say something about “Bug-men in the South” before he charged off. Maybe he asked around at the Inn too, they may know more.
Well, I’m off. Good luck with your search, and watch yourself out there. The ones who committed this attack may still be out there and looking for trouble.

Extract any information about Elatt's weaknesses from the prisoner that you can. Failing that, test the durability of any part of her body that's made of light. In doing so, we may find out what Elatt is truly capable of.
Well, a missionary from the Holy Mission! Keep the forest free from the Scourge for us, will you?
I can’t believe Levant would dare attack the Blue Chamber. And in the middle of a council meeting!
Something on your mind, [PlayerName]?
Lockwell had Oliele moved. Did you hear anything about what happened?

Perhaps. I noticed Lockwell's guard coming back from the Marsh the other day, with an empty bag over his shoulder. I've seen him make other trips like this, usually to the old ruined city in the south-west of the swamp.
Well done, [PlayerName].
How can you say "Well Done"? Zephyrien is dead and Oliele ran away to Abrassar!
You're fine with Oliele just leaving like that?
Oliele must find her own answers. And though I worry what she might discover, I have faith that the best interests of Aurai are in her heart.
You put your faith in her even though she doubts you?
Doubt is the first step to understanding. Understanding is the first step to trust. As long as she acts with Aurai's good in mind, that's all that matters to me.
What about the Disciple she killed?

Some of them have become complacent in their faith. After I chose Richard to become a Disciple, he became... dogmatic. He preferred to follow the letter of the faith but not the heart... Despite my repeated warnings, his pride grew too large, and it cost him his life.
Couldn’t you just take away his promotion, if he was no longer worthy of it?
If only I could. Once I bestow my power on someone, I can no longer take it back. Not without killing them. Even gods are capable of mistakes, and when we do, the consequences are never pleasant.
Such is the curse of divinity. I can impact the world greatly, but every move is dangerous the moment it's out of my hands. With Zephyrien gone, things will only get harder.
Couldn't you have saved Zephyrien, like you saved Oliele?

The poison that he was struck with contained more than just venom. It held Corruption so strong that even I could only slow its progress through Zephyrien's body. It was all I could to do keep him alive until you arrived.
There is great danger in our future. I will bestow upon you a blessing, to better protect you, and those you care for. Take which you believe will make you most effective.

Choose between two blessings. My Spiritual Communion increases the power of your Ethereal, Decay and Light abilities. Or, gain my Divine Assistance, which shall let you fight and cast spells with more ease.
I will receive the Spiritual Communion.
I request your Divine Assistance.
I’m shocked to hear about what happened to Zephyrien. He was an impressive fighter, and a friend to all. To hear that he was slain...This is a grave blow to all who follow Elatt.
This was the bullet that killed Zephyrien. What can you tell me about it?
Give me a moment. I'll get my alchemy set and I'll let you know what I find out.

This is a puzzle, [PlayerName]. The liquid is a mixture of Assassin Bug venom, and carefully distilled blood from an Immaculate, one of the man-like Scourge Beasts that can think and reason. I think the venom is designed to paralyze the victim, while the Immaculate's blood is the real killer.
Assassin bugs only live in Abrassar desert, and only Sorobor would have the knowledge and equipment to distill something as dangerous as Scourge Beast blood to this level.
To make things more complicated, this tsar stone bullet casing was clearly forged in the magma forges in Sirroco. Nothing else could have penetrated Zephyrien's Candle Armor so cleanly.
So that's the Kingdom of Levant, the Immaculates, Sirroco, and Sorobor all possibly tied to the killing bullet…
Any of them or all of them. Watch your back, my friend. Either someone has begun to make a move against the Holy Mission, or we’re being used as pawns in someone’s game.
I’ve been alive for a very long time, and I never seen a Council meeting that could harm the Holy Mission’s interests so much…
The fact we have our own Chamberlord, Mathias, in Berg almost full-time does reassure me. I just hope he’s adept enough at playing politics to help us sidestep this crisis.
If this is about that woman I locked up, I’m not changing my mind. Until my investigation is complete, she does not leave that cell.
I'm here as her friend. We grew up together. I’m worried about her treatment here.

Ah. I understand. Unfortunately, that doesn’t change the fact that she’s here under suspicion of murder. You’ll just have to wait until we’re done our investigation. If it turns out it really was self-defense, we’ll let her go.
How about I speed that investigation along with some silver?
Are you trying to bribe me? I suggest you think very hard about that decision.
Here, I think 500 silvers should hire you a few more investigators.
Think of the improvements to Monsoon you could make with 200 silvers.
100 silvers should cover her bail, right?
How does 50 silvers sound?
Have you lost your mind? Why would I agree to this? Out with you, before I have you arrested for trying to bribe an official!
My my, she must really mean a lot to you... Alright, I'll take it. I know a good deal when I see one.
Hmm... alright, I'll take it. I'll forget that you bribed me, this time. But I won't forget you.
You owe me, Lockwell. Let her go. It's not worth starting trouble over a self-defense case.
Well, I am a man of my word. Fine. The evidence was clear enough anyway.
Let her go. Now. Or else.
Or else what? Do you honestly think you can threaten a Chamberlord?
If you threaten a member of the Holy Mission, you threaten all of us.
Excuse me? This is my city. Not Elatt's. He's just squatting here. I am the one who rules Monsoon!
Do you really want to anger the god that was able to destroy the Scourge?
And do you really believe that he would dare ruin his precious image by harming to me? All for one lowly missionary?
We are all important to him. Punishing one Chamberlord for overstepping his bounds wouldn’t be out of line for him.
And I don't think he would. I'll take my chances, thank you. Consider your bluff called.
He doesn't need to. He could use this incident as a reason to revoke his protection over Monsoon and let the Scourge punish you instead.
Tch. I can’t take that chance. The people will not come to harm by my hand while I rule Monsoon.
Someone killed one of his champions, and now you're holding a missionary on flimsy charges. This makes you look mighty suspicious, Lockwell.
I don't care. Someone is dead in my city, and I'm not going to let the culprit go until we've had a proper investigation. End of story. Even Elatt should understand that.
We respect your right to rule Monsoon... but if you keep pushing us like this, you will find that all of Monsoon will turn on you. Elatt will see to it.
I can’t take that risk... but don’t think your precious “god” can get away with this extortion forever. If he thinks he can just eliminate our free will, he will find that Aurai will prove him wrong.
Fine. You win, you ruthless bastard. I won't forget this degrading talk, [PlayerName].
Your threats don't scare me. I'm not going to let her go. And I'm not going to forget what you said to me. You’ve made a very powerful enemy today.
Take her and get out. The evidence was pretty clear anyway. She killed that disciple in self-defense.
Oliele? I'm afraid I don't know what you're talking about. I let her go already. Perhaps you just missed her?
I'll go look for her, then.
You and I both know that you're lying.
Making accusations without proof? How very like someone serving that freakish spectral fiend. Oliele isn't here, you can see for yourself.
What's with that look, priest?
Missionary, actually. Where's Oliele?
The girl with the glowing arms and eyes? No idea. Nope. She’s not serving her sentence here anymore.
Will 50 silvers jog your memory?

Alright, you didn't hear this from me. There's the ruins of an old city in the swamp. It's kind of to the South West. I just dropped her off...from there some other guys took her. They can't gotten that far…
With 90 silvers jog your memory?

Oh... That's a lot of silver. Alright, listen. There's the ruins of an old city in the swamp along the Pilgrim Road. It's kind of to the south west. There’s this Flooded Cellar that Lockwell sometimes asks me to move prisoners to.

Look, I do this with prisoners from time to time. Lockwell pays me extra to drug the prisoners and make the transfers as long as I don't ask too many questions. I don't know what happens at their destination and frankly I don't care.
Sorry, I’m not allowed to let anyone talk to the prisoner. Shoo, would you?
You look like you haven’t eaten well for a while. Lockwell not paying you enough?
I broke my mace on the last trip I made into the marsh. When you have to choose between self-defense or rationing dinner, self-defense always wins. I could really use a pay raise...
Keep your distance, an investigation is in progress!
What’s going on?
I’ll leave you to it, then.

There was a murder. A missionary from the Holy Mission killed a disciple in broad daylight. Until the matter is resolved, the accused will remain in the custody of Damian Lockwell. If you have further questions, speak with Ellinara!
Who is the suspect?
That woman with body parts made of light. Oliele, I think her name is.
Who was the victim?

Richard. He was one of the newer disciples of the Holy Mission. Wouldn’t stop being a preachy git at the inn ever since he got promoted. He’d just gotten back from a trip to Sirroco before this happened.
Wait, Oliele?! I don’t believe that.
We have about 8 witnesses who testify that she did it. Most of them claim that it was self-defense, but Damian Lockwell has ordered us to treat it like a murder while we investigate.
Again, if you have any questions, speak with Ellinara. We are just doing our job here!
“Zephyrien has been eliminated. We’ve left him in the old crypt under the tree on the island on the lake.”
[PlayerName], Elatt needs your strength again.
He needs you to go find Oliele in the Abrassar desert. He believes she is on the verge of an important discovery, and that she will need your help to complete it.
Why me?
Because she trusts you. She would see anyone else from the Holy Mission as a threat.
Why should we care about her? She left us.
Even a lost sheep is still one of the flock. Elatt says she needs help. So we will help her. That's how it goes.
Alright, I'm on it.
Oliele should be in the slums of Levant, in the Abrassar desert. It's a difficult journey. Prepare yourself for the desert heat.
You've accomplished a lot in such a short time, Missionary. Cardinal Bourlamaque wanted to see you. I think you'll be working under him from now on. Congratulations on your promotion!

You need someone who can translate the Old Language for you? I remember that Sorobor recently unearthed something that could be of use...And Mofat was alive back before the Scourge, so it’s likely he remembers the Old Language.

You’re looking for some of our members who have doubts? I do know there was a group that was talking a lot recently... I think they went out to a cave connected to one of the giant lotus plants in the Marsh.
Even far out here, I feel Elatt's eyes fixed on me. Nowhere feels safe for me anymore.
Elatt sent you, didn't he, [PlayerName]? To keep an eye on me?
I'm here to help you with your search. Ellinara said you were close to discovering something.
Don't think I'm happy about this long trip either, Oliele. How goes the search?
I've managed to dig up three leads on Elatt's origins. An ancient Garden, the Old Levant Ruins, and the Stone Titan's cave. Any of them might have what we're looking for.
The ancient Garden is within sight of Levant itself. It's the only place where anything still grows out here. If it's the only place the devastation didn't touch... There must be a reason.

Secondly, there are the ruins of Old Levant, where Elatt was born. They may still have records of his mortal life. Abrassar's Vigil was built above it, so there's an easy landmark for us to use to get there.
Finally, there's the Stone Titan's Cave. The giant stone statues that the cave is named for only appeared around the time the Scourge happened. It's too strange to be a coincidence.
Where should we check next?
Let's check the garden.
I'll meet you there, then. You can see it from the front gate of Levant, it's not too far.
Old Levant sounds like the best lead.
I agree. It's right next to Abrassar's Vigil, so it shouldn't be too hard to find. The soroborean merchant said the front gate should be unlocked now too! See you there!
I'm mighty curious about the Stone Titan's Cave.
Yes, me too. It's not too far from Old Levant. When you start seeing enormous stone statues, you'll know you're in the right place. Well, I'm off.

This is interesting... Elatt actually has nothing to do with this Garden. There was a Lich that used to live here. His protective spells are what keep the Garden growing after the great river of Abrassar was diverted away.

This Lich left records suggesting that he used to feed on a Ley Line that crossed under the Stone Titan's Cave , but that it was destroyed around the time the Scourge appeared. That might be a good place to explore…
I had no idea Sorobor was excavating these ruins. Although there’s plenty of evidence there were bandits recently camping here... Either way, I found some historical information here.
What did you find?
Elatt lived a pretty interesting life. He changed a lot from from his younger days. He abandoned his powerful family over some... frankly tragic business and that was the last anyone here saw of him.

These records show that there used to be a Ley Line under where the Stone Titan’s cave is now. The day that the Scourge happened, mages from Old Levant felt the Ley Line swell and then be destroyed...
The coincidences just keep piling up around that cave. For an entire Ley Line to vanish... Something powerful must have happened there. It might be a good place to go examine next.

I think we've really hit it big, [PlayerName]. Something terrible happened here, I can sense it in the air. And I've found this tablet. It's in the Old Language. I can't read it. But right there... that's Elatt's name in the text, I think. Dammit, if only we could read the rest!
Do we know anyone who can translate this?
Let's take this back to Monsoon. I'm positive someone can get it done there. I’ll meet you back there.
If anyone's got a way to translate this, it would be a Soroborean... or if we knew someone extremely old... Mofat! He said he knew Elatt when He was still human, right?
You're right, the man is ancient. He might know how to translate the Old Language.
If Mofat won’t do it for us, we can try the local Soroborean merchant, although I can’t imagine they’d sell any solution to our problem for cheap.
You’ve got what we need? Wonderful, let’s find out what this tablet has to say!

I don't understand. The Scourge destroyed so much of Aurai... If it was supposed to kill only Elatt, then how come it didn't? How come it caused the very ground around him to explode and give birth to the Scourge Beasts, and ascended Elatt to godhood?
Elatt... Did he cause this calamity on purpose? Did the spell fail? Is Elatt himself part of the Scourge? What happened? I wish I could just ask him.
Then why don’t we? He wanted to hear what we discovered either way.
Yes. I think we should. I think we have enough to question him about. I'm going to his Altar in the temple.

Elatt, what are you? The Cabal of Winds used a spell to kill you. Designed to fill your spirit with Corruption and turn it against you. And yet you live on as a god, and the Scourge struck Aurai instead. Are you really the man that was struck by that spell?
I understand. I'm sorry I doubted you, Elatt. I shouldn't have questioned your motives.
I'll find them, Elatt. I'll set them straight again. [PlayerName], let's split up, we'll cover ground faster.
I'm having trouble convincing them on my own... We need your voice, [PlayerName].
I'm glad we were able to talk sense into them. The more people who can understand and accept the truth, the better. You're a pretty good speaker, [PlayerName].
It's a shame they didn't see eye to eye with us. I'm sorry to see them go. Still, it is their decision to make.
What will you do?
I'm going to stay with the Holy Mission. The end goal for me is the complete destruction of the Scourge, and I feel like we just got a few steps closer. This revelation doesn't change that.
So, this is the true face of the Holy Mission. Words and hopes and dreams... and if you don't accept them, you're put to death. I can't stay here. I'm done.
You're leaving the Holy Mission?
Yes. I joined Elatt's cause to help and save others. I wanted to put an end to the Scourge. After today... I think I can do far better on my own..
Here. Take my sword. You'll make better use of this than I will.
You've been a true friend to me, [PlayerName]. Thank you.
Here. I want you to have this. I think I’ll make myself a new one in commemoration of my rebirth. I want to start over now that I’m certain of my path in life.
The cardinal wanted to promote me to Templar for what we did. I told him to wait. I’m no longer sure if I want to pursue the martial path or the philosopher’s path.
On one hand, I want to change the world with my words. On the other I want to destroy the Scourge with my own two hands if I can... It’s a hard decision to make.
Let’s regroup in Levant, I need supplies.
Good idea. I’ll meet you back in the Levant Slums, [PlayerName].
