We can only stretch the Headmaster’s patience about 20 days at most. If you show up late, we risk losing any leverage you might have earned. So get on it, [PlayerName]. It’s do or die.

Alright Immaculate, we’re on the clock. We’ll need to skip over some of the precautions I talked to you about and get started right now. The sooner we begin, the more time we’ll have to get this done right!
Understood. Ready or not, we are out of time. Do what you need to do, Turnbull.
No time, can’t talk, I’m up to my eyeballs in complex spellwork right now and can’t afford a distraction!
Ugh...This feels...Wrong. I feel like parts of my body are trying to burst out of me...Whatever Turnbull is doing is at least having some effect...

I keep going over the runes that Turnbull wants us to use. I think these should work, but...Considering we don’t fully understand what kind of spell was used to create the Scourge, there’s far too many unknowns for my liking.
We’re counting on you to get that extra support, [PlayerName]. Leave this to us!
You’re one of Turnbull’s Initiates, aren’t you? I must confess my shock that you would do something as foolhardy as bringing an Immaculate into the city.
I sincerely hope that Turnbull can actually prove that it is possible to pacify them. If he’s wrong...There may be considerable consequences for the danger that he put our Academy in.

Now, hold on for just one moment. Do you realize that [PlayerName] was the one who exposed Jager Sullivan’s crimes? They had no reason to take such action if they were using nefarious means. I will have no sullying of their name at this conference!
...I am unconvinced by your experiment, Turnbull...But I’m willing to give you a chance, regardless. Stopping the Scourge demands bold, decisive action.
(You have the distinct impression that Headmaster Salaberry has repaid the favor he owes you...)
Well, hey. Looks like your branch of the academy is in some real hot water now. I’m going to enjoy watching these fireworks.
Turnbull needs a potion that will reduce a creature’s resistance to Rune Magic.
Wait...You’re coming to ME for help? I’m in enough trouble as it is these days, I don’t need any more-...Wait...If you scratch our back, we’ll scratch yours. There’s something I need help with.

So, some...People I was working with have gone and turned on me. They want a pay raise, and have stolen some of my goods until I give them what they want. Recover my goods, and inform them they’re being let go, and I’ll get you what you need.
Why do I get the feeling none of this is...Legal?
You know what they say about throwing stones in glass houses, don’t you? You’re working with LITERAL monsters. You don’t get to judge. Are you in, or not?
Alright, let’s trade services. I save your hide, you save ours.
No thank you. I will have no part in this!

In the east of the Antique Plateau, just North of the Cultural District, you’ll find what’s left of the Fourwinds District. Look for a ruined house with a dangling skeleton not far from it. My former allies are in there.
Tell the goons inside our arrangement is over, and then come back here with my little wooden box. How you manage to do that is entirely up to you.

Well, I’ll be. You came back with the goods. I’m glad I took a gamble on you! Your friend, Desy, she came around here while you were gone. She’s already taken the potion to Turnbull for use in your little science project. Best of luck to you, then!
Well well, you again. The Soroborean who came for that little Sirocco box all that while ago. Ain’t this a surprise!
You’ve taken some goods that belong to Erica Kasper. Hand them back over.

We’re outlaws, punk, we take what we want. And that hag up in the academy hasn’t been paying us what she promised either. We’re taking these goods and we’re getting out of this place to go find more profitable routes to plunder!
So no, you ain’t gettin’ her stuff back. In fact...Drop your bag and empty your pockets! Or don’t! Any excuse to shank someone today would make me REAL happy!
(This looks like the box of Erica’s stolen goods! Better take them back to her!)
They say history favors the bold. So, as reckless as your Dean’s plan to pacify the Scourge is...I do hope he succeeds. That would be quite an excellent addition to Sorobor’s storied history.
We need a favor. Would you be willing to support us at the debate?

Ah, you want my voice, do you? Well, this timing is most opportune. To my dismay, I actually do have need of a nasty ruin-diving mercenary thug for something. Get me what I need, and I’ll gladly give you my support.

I’ve always wanted to properly examine the Old Theater in the East of Antique Plateau. Unfortunately, the bridge was destroyed long before I was even born. But, I’ve heard tell that it’s possible to get in there from the old tunnels underneath the region.
If you can find a way to get to that Old Theater, I need to you to find a particular painting that was last seen there. It’s a simple portrait of the man who founded Harmattan.
Bring it to me, safe and unblemished, and I will trust in you and Turnbull, no matter what your other actions have been thus far.
One piece of art, brought here safely, got it.
On second thought, I’ve changed my mind, I don’t think I need your help.
I found the portrait!
This is...Hah! I must apologize for my conduct towards you earlier. You have done the history of Aurai much good today, [PlayerName]. I will be sure to sing your praises at the debate.
(This looks like the portrait that Joliette asked you to find! You gently pack it up to bring home.)
So...I hear you guys have been trying to use magic to make the Scourge less violent? I can’t even pretend to understand how that would work, but if it actually does, I’ll applaud your cleverness.
I need a favor. Is there something you can do to shore up the city’s defenses?

City’s security, huh...We do have about a dozen Golems we use for maintenance practice for the apprentices...We could get them all up and running if you want. I do have something I’ll need done in return, however.

You know that the old Golem Fabrication facility opened up a while back, right? Well, there are some very rare and ancient parts I need from there. Bring them to me, and I’ll get you those extra Golems. Deal?

I need you to find 3 Mana Filters. You should be able to find some in the Compromised Mana Transfer Station, which should be connected to the old Golem Test Chambers. They should be connected to some wall-mounted device, emitting blue-ish vapor.
Deal. I’ll get you the parts you need!
I don’t think I have time to waste fetching you old junk. I’ll ask someone else for help.
I got the parts you need!

Ah, right on time. The Golems have been put back together and are ready to go. So, I’ll just take these parts, and go tell my Master of Repairs to send the Golems out on patrol. Nice doing business with you!
What are you planning to do with those filters I got for you?

One of my Initiates just put together a completely mad plan to deliver entire Marshmelon plants from Monsoon to Levant. The initial prototype worked as intended, so now it’s time to take his plan up a notch!

These parts will not only let us improve the specialized vats we need to bring the Marshmelons with, but will also let us grow the fruits ourselves outside the marsh, allowing us to cut out the Monsoon middleman entirely. Maximum profit!
If you’ll be able to grow them outside the marsh, why not sell that tech to Levant?

Why should we? We stand to make considerably more profit if we keep it to ourselves and only sell them the end product! ...You WILL keep this our little secret, won’t you? It’d make the Academy look bad if you ran your mouth about it!
(This looks like one of the Mana Filters that Samuel wanted... It’s lighter than you thought!)
(You’ve picked up all the parts you were asked for!)

I can’t believe you resorted to sabotage. I know we can’t prove it, but it’s obvious. The Immaculates have turned you into criminals! And for what? Because you think you can “heroically save the poor poor monsters from themselves”?!

Now more than ever, I know that I’m on the right side! Victor would never compromise his morals on a half-dream of a theory like Turnbull would! You’re risking the safety of the entire city on a fantasy!
You’re completely wrong. And forgetting that Victor made a deal with the Butcher.

You’ve invited one of the enemy into Harmattan itself! I don’t know where you’re hiding it, but the Tracker Coil’s Scourge Detector doesn’t lie! Don’t you dare put yourself on the same level as Victor!
It’s for good reason. We actually CAN cure them! He’s already pacified an Illuminator!

Even if it’s for a “good cause” like you say, Turnbull is putting everyone in the city in danger! There is nothing that’s worth that kind of a risk! What if he’s wrong about the Immaculate? What if it’s just waiting to stab you all in the back?
Victor might have his faults, but he’s at least going about things the right way! Accuse him of whatever you want, he’s still more trustworthy than a literal monster!
(Are you ready to begin the debate?)
Oh, there you are, [PlayerName]! You’re just in time!
About time, [PlayerName]! You’re late!
Indeed. This delay is inexcusable, and reflects poorly on your master’s case, Initiate!
Oh, was this the initiate we were waiting on? Excellent. I am quite looking forward to seeing the fruits of this research, inquiry or not!

Very well, all the involved parties are here. We can begin. Victor Berthelot, you are accusing Gregory Turnbull of cooperating with the Scourge to undermine the safety of Harmattan. Please, make your case.
From the very start, Turnbull and his underlings have consistently used underhanded and criminal means to accomplish their goals! One underling in particular, that one standing right there!

The Wolfgang Mercenaries have reported an exhaustive list of complaints against [PlayerName]! Regardless of their outsider status, the Wolfgang Mercenaries are still an essential part of life in Harmattan, and they should be listened to!

For instance, [PlayerName] allowed several Immaculates to escape a trap set by the Wolfgang. The Immaculates have since completely escaped our grasp, and have caused who knows how much harm?! This clearly proves they’re working for the enemy!

Remember that tunnel that was a risk to the entire city? The Wolfgang have confirmed that [PlayerName] inflicted grevious bodily harm on the men who were there to guard the tunnel, putting not just their lives, but the lives of all of Harmattan, at serious risk!

I have signed letters from several of the merchants in the market square, who say that [PlayerName] has been exceptionally helpful to them. I’d say my Initiate has been an exceptional credit to the comfort of the citizens of Harmattan.
Are you certain that the Wolfgang didn’t start a fight with [PlayerName], forcing them to defend themselves? It wouldn’t be the first time those mercenaries picked a fight they shouldn’t have.
Both of our provosts have submitted evidence that [PlayerName] has been a great credit to the both of them. Are you certain you’re accusing the correct person, Victor?

I simply must express that until these complaints are fully addressed, [PlayerName] and thus, Gregory Turnbull should be scrutinized at the highest level! Well, what do you have to say for yourself? I demand an answer!
Says the one who was making deals with the Butcher of Men.
Preposterous! I merely attempted to entrap him. There isn’t a single witness who would corroborate that outlandish claim, that doesn’t have a reason to lie about it! Isn’t that right, Artois?

...Victor speaks the truth. He, in no way, made any kind of deal with the Butcher of Men. The only ones who try to make that claim are [PlayerName] and Desy, and both of their testimony is extremely suspect!
How can we trust the Wolfgang not to be lying on your behalf? You are close allies.
How DARE you attack their credibility! They have been essential to the security of the region since before you were BORN!

[PlayerName] brings up a valid point. You and the Wolfgang Mercenaries work very closely together, and the lot of you have a vested interest in continued open conflict with the Scourge. If anyone’s motives are to be suspected, it’s your own!
What about when you contracted the Wolfgang to hunt me down after I left you?

I’m afraid I don’t know what you’re talking about. Is there any way you can prove that? Your testimony alone is absolutely meaningless here. After all, you’re the one whose motives are being scrutinized!
Besides, if you’re going to sling baseless accusations, I know you committed acts of sabotage against us! The Wolfgang said so!
And plotting to destroy an ancient and important Rune Wall isn’t sabotage?

[PlayerName] is correct. There was no need to place the explosives on the Rune wall itself, unless destroying it was half the point of that tunnel demolition! And lest you forget, wilful destruction of important history is a criminal act!
Artois, enough! Baseless accusations only serve to make us look weak!
Do you have more than just the unproven accusations of a mercenary gang as proof?
Silence, both of you! Shameless accusations without proof have no place here!
If pacifying the Scourge is possible...Wouldn’t your actions count as sabotage?

IF it’s possible. Your theory has not been proven. Whereas OUR actions have all been to protect the safety of Harmattan. I’d say we have the moral high ground here. Your petty deflection is worthless.

I have heard enough, Victor. I have worked with [PlayerName] personally in recovering our lost history. The artifact was returned with care, which is more than I can say for our interactions in that regard. I will allow no slander of their reputation in my presence!

Hmm...I’m afraid that I find your evidence inconclusive, Victor. I don’t see enough evidence to pass any kind of decisive judgment on the activities of Turnbull and his initiates. A full investigation will be performed at a later date. For now, let us move on.

Enough. You have made your point, Victor. Turnbull and his Initiates have engaged in conduct that is at best irresponsible and at worst unlawful. A proper trial will be convened at a later date to determine the extent of the harm caused. For now, let us move on.

Very well. I would also argue that given the abysmal state of security in this city, and the impending threat of a Scourge invasion, we cannot trust in pacifying them! It would be incredibly dangerous to attempt any interaction with the Scourge at this time!

And due to the sabotage that we still insist that Turnbull ordered, several Scourge beasts managed to enter the city and kill innocent people! Until we are certain that every last means of entry have been sealed, we cannot afford any risk to our safety!

Furthermore, even if we ignore the Scourge, there is a gang of organized and well-armed bandits who are roaming around, waylaying caravans and traders. And they appear to have received a dramatic resupply of weapons as well!

Come now, you’ve been boasting about the power of your new Golems for quite a while. In fact, I’m rather certain that [PlayerName] ensured the prototype was essentially perfect. You do have to have faith in your own project, right?
I...Well...Yes. But that’s not the point! It’s still dangerous to deal with the Scourge like this, whether or not my new Golems are ready!
I’d like to mention that the Butcher of Men is confirmed to be dead. The most vicious of the Immaculates is long gone. Without his leadership, the Scourge are considerably hamstrung.
I...Alright, that’s fair. But who knows what other vicious Immaculates might be ready to take his place as the most vicious and cruel being known to mankind?

And do you actually think we can TRUST the Scourge after we pacify them? Free will still allows room for criminal, or even monstrous behaviour! Besides, what about the unintelligent Scourge? They don’t have the intellect to do anything but rampage!
Can you trust humans? Quite a few become vicious bandits.

Yes, I’d trust bandits over the Scourge. Outlaws are just individuals and small clans, not a massive horde that has spent the last century laying waste to all that breathes. Look outside at the mass of ruins out there! That’s all their handiwork!
So, you’d prefer they remain a unified horde dedicated only to slaughter?
I…N-no, I’d rather they be wiped out entirely! I question the ENTIRE merit of the experiment! We know that killing the Scourge works, we should be focusing on ways to make that easier!

Well, there’s no easy method for that. Even if we had hundreds of your new Golems, it would still take another century at least to put an end to the Scourge. Pacifying them does far more to remove the active threat the Scourge pose.
The Immaculates will be able to control the Scourge Beasts. They won’t rampage.
Oh, so the beings that can potentially choose evil will still be able to direct them to cause harm. I fail to see how that’s much of an improvement!

And what about the Wolfgang? If we go along with this harebrained scheme of yours, what happens if they don’t have enough work fighting the Scourge, and are forced to turn bandit in order to make ends meet? It would endanger the entire region!
Aurai is still dangerous. There will always be work for a famous group like them.

Yeah, or they could come help the war camps at the Gates of Catharsis if they want to actually make a difference. It’s obscene how they claim to be so essential to fighting the Scourge, while they mostly just hide in that well-defended camp of theirs!
If they’d do that, then they were never really our allies to begin with.

You did not grow up in Harmattan, hearing of how they helped restore the region after Elatt came to our aid, so your ignorance is not surprising. How DARE you suggest that those who have done so much for us are not our allies!
Hmm...Victor is right. The Wolfgang have done much for us, and for the stability of the region. If you believe such such callous things, I suggest you keep them to yourself, [PlayerName].
So...Their employment matters more than protecting humanity from the Scourge?
Of course not, and how dare you suggest I meant that! I merely want to ensure a fair transition, so that they are not rewarded for their decades of service with sudden and unavoidable poverty!

You both make a strong point. We cannot put one organization’s survival over the safety of humanity as a whole, but neither should we abandon allies who have done so much for us. I will need to think more on how to handle this...

Mate, I don’t see how you’re still worried about the city’s security. Even if that small force of Scourge were to attack the city, we’ve got a veritable army of Golems on patrol. The Scourge would be torn to shreds before they even made it up the cliff.
Hmm, I’m inclined to believe that the security of the city is strong enough to proceed, Victor. I see no reason to halt the project on those grounds.

Turnbull, I’m afraid I must agree with Victor. There are too many risks to the city at the moment. Unless you’ve got something very convincing in store, I may need to ask you to postpone your research until things have been properly secured.
Only one question remains in my mind...Turnbull, were your attempts successful? Can you prove to me that it is possible to pacify an Immaculate?
I wish to know this as well. To me, this is single most important part of this inquiry. As far as I’m concerned, all else can be forgiven if it can be done. Please, tell me everything!

We have discovered that what drives the Scourge to attack Elatt’s followers in a frenzy is the effect of a spell. It seems that whomever or whatever created them did so for the express purpose of killing Elatt, and thus the Scourge are bound by that single instinct.

Therefore, I have developed a Counter-Spell that will nullify that command. In the bestial Scourge, it can provably turn them into mere animals, without the urge for mass violence against all that breathes.
And in Immaculates, it will give them the ability to ignore their instinct, and choose not to act upon it. It will remove their unifying purpose, and make them true individuals.
I’m still waiting on proof that this is even possible, Turnbull. Either show us that it’s possible, or stop wasting our time!
With pleasure. Desy? Could you go fetch our mutual friend?
You...Actually brought an Immaculate INTO the city?! Have you lost your mind?! If you’re wrong, he’ll immediately slaughter me and then-
HSSSS, your presence here fills me with anger...But...I can choose to withhold that anger. I would urge you to bite your tongue unless you absolutely MUST speak, Elatt-spawn.
Well well...An Immaculate and a priest of Elatt in the same room together. And the Immaculate can even speak Elatt’s name without succumbing to murderous rage. I am quite impressed, Turnbull!

I...Me too. ...Alright, I’ve seen enough. I won’t aggravate the creature further. Now, If you’ll excuse me, I have a letter to send to the Cardinal. He will want to know about this as soon as humanly possible.
Gahh....Nnngg...Make him leave...Make him leave! It hurts to have him near! Make him leave, or I will kill him where he stands!

Well...That IS an improvement, if barely. It would seem like your theory needs more work, Turnbull. This isn’t the war-changing breakthrough you claimed it would be. It seems another few months of work will be necessary, at least!
I feel the same. Very well, I will leave this discussion for now. Come speak to me once it is over, Salaberry, we will need to have a long discussion about this.
We are pushing the boundaries of magic, Headmaster. I would have preferred to wait another month or two until the research was complete, but Victor insisted this be discussed immediately.

And that seems to have been wise. Clearly the experiment is a failure and should be abandoned before it wastes more precious resources! We should focus our efforts on my new Golem improvements, which will slaughter the Scourge hordes with ease!

Well, I think we can say that the alchemic mix we provided is at least somewhat responsible for the experiment’s success. Honestly, I’m pretty impressed, considering what bloodthirsty maniacs the Immaculates usually are!
You realize I am still present, human? Bite your tongue, before I bite it for you!

This was all a big deal over nothing. Even if you can change the nature of individual Immaculates, that won’t change much of anything. Do you plan to invite the entire Scourge horde into Harmattan to pacify them one at a time?

Obviously not. The runic phrase emits an aura that expands over time. Anything that stays in contact with that aura for long enough will be affected by it. Careful placement of these runes will allow us to pacify the Scourge long-term.
The plan is to create runic totems, strategically placed in each region, and around any known entrance to the Gates of Catharsis. Then, we just let the aura expand and do its work.

In fact, our friend here might be able to act as an ambassador of sorts. The runic phrase is imprinted on his very body. Any Scourge he remains near for long enough should be permanently pacified by the counter-spell.
It’s by no means an instant solution, but it should radically change the course of our conflict with the Scouge within our lifetimes.
You want to just...”Plop down” a spell with such a far reaching, ever-expanding effect, all over Aurai...Just like that? The side effects of a spell like that could be devastating!
I would argue that the Scourge are far worse. Have you seen the ruins outside?
I’d pick the demons we know over the demons we don’t! A spell with an effect so immense is far too great a risk to ever place our hopes on!

I’m afraid I must disagree, Victor. The Scourge hordes continue to make civilization barely tenable, even with the Vigil Crystals and Elatt’s help. This is a risk, yes, but one that comes with great possibilities.
You don’t seem to think the same of unleashing more Golems that could go rogue!
Yeah, there’s plenty of Golems who are roaming wild with no control just outside our front door. They kill plenty of people every season. How can you guarantee that won’t happen with yours?

Faulty Golems can be repaired, and returned to their proper mission parameters. If the side-effects of the spell soak into Aurai itself long-term, the effects would be infinitely harder to contain or reverse! It’s a matter of scale, girl!
It’s a spell with an incredibly narrow effect. You’re overstating the risk of side effects.

Am I? Turnbull claims that the Scourge are influenced by a spell designed to kill Elatt. That too, is a spell with an incredibly narrow effect. And yet, look at all the destruction they have wrought! I think my concern is quite valid, [PlayerName].

You make a compelling argument, Victor. There should be months...No, years of rigorous testing before a plan like this is put into effect. I want to know exactly what potential side effects there might be.
And you are certain this single counter-spell will work on all the Scourge that come into contact with it? Every single sub-species? How thorough was your research?
The Scourge are all directed by one spell. One counter-spell should work, then.

We would be taking a considerable risk if you’re wrong. It is unlikely that a universal solution will be so easy. Just because it works on Immaculates and Illuminators doesn’t prove it’ll work on Shelled Horrors or Grotesques!
We can fine-tune it later. The species that really matters is the Immaculates.

[PlayerName] is right. Starting with them will cripple the brains behind the Scourge, which will stop the worst of the attacks. From there, we can proceed to make any changes we need to, if the counter-spell happens to not be universal.
...Hmm...Indeed. This would provoke dramatic change, even if it does not resolve the entire problem outright. I have no outright objections to that proposal.
We won’t know until we try, right? And we can’t try unless you give us your approval.
...Fair point. I suppose we won’t know the full effects until we try it. I confess myself skeptical...But perhaps...
Are you merely going to speak for me, and about me, as if I am not present?! Do I not deserve to speak for myself?
No! You are a monster, a creature created purely for destruction! You have no such right! Consider yourself lucky to even be breathing, Immaculate!

Monster, am I? I am a monster only by the circumstance of my creation, human. I did not choose this form, nor did I ask for my killing urge. What do you say we compare the actions we have taken, given the freedom we are capable of?

You have the freedom to pursue whatever you please, and yet you choose to do harm. You use your words to cause hurt, your power to dominate and control, and you ally with men who will slay anyone, innocent or not, on the promise of coin!
You...You DARE lecture me, Scourge Beast?!

Meanwhile, I chose to come here, risking my life and the life of my kin, on the smallest chance that I could obtain that same freedom you abuse. I fought claw and talon against my instinct to cause harm, and searched for a way to overcome it!

Your intentions, your circumstances of birth...All of these are meaningless! It is your actions that determine who you truly are. And I have confidence that the few actions I was freely able to make are less monstrous than those you made fully willingly!
That is enough, Immaculate. There is no need for personal attacks. I have made my decision.

And you, head master of these humans, are hardly any better. Look at some of those you have surrounded yourself with. You have the chance to make them do better, and yet you do not. You are nearly as guilty as they are.

You all claim that we Immaculates must use our new freedom responsibly, to guide and control the rest of the Scourge. And yet, YOU, human head master, do not do the same for the humans you are responsible for!

...You are quite right, Immaculate. I have indeed compromised, in order to create what I believe is a better world. But compromise is the way of humanity. And that...Is why I will give you and your kin a chance. Everyone deserves one, no matter their origin.

Enough. While I am impressed with your efforts, Turnbull, I don’t share the sentiment that this is a feasible large-scale solution. And I concur with Victor’s other very valid concerns. This project is cancelled. Permanently.
That’s enough. Although this experiment shows great promise...I cannot turn a blind eye to the other concerns. Turnbull, I forbid you from continuing work until further notice.
Hmph. I should have known. Humanity cannot be trusted to help us. No one can.
As for you, Immaculate...You have not harmed anyone here, so, I will allow you to leave. But should we find you again, you will be treated as any other Scourge Beast.
Hmph, your fairness is noted, human. You will not see me again.

Now, as to the matter of the invading Scourge Beasts...Our Tracker Power Coil suspects they’re holed up in Old Harmattan. Please, allow me to deploy our new Golems! Let me show you what they are capable of!
Granted. You have authority to proceed as you see fit. See to the destruction of those Scourge immediately, Victor!
And you, Turnbull...If you and your Initiates wish to prove to me that you are not, in fact, in league with those Scourge...
I understand, Headmaster. [PlayerName], Desy, I need you to go assist Victor’s forces at Old Harmattan!
Doing anything for Victor leaves a real bad taste in my mouth, but fine. Killin’ some hostile Scourge is no problem for me.
Heh, well, it’s nice to have the two of you back on the right side, even if it’s just for a short while. Perhaps you’ll see the error of your ways now.
...Don’t push your luck, Victor.
Alright, alright, enough gloating. What’s the plan?

I seem to have struck a nerve, I see. Very well, there is a small cave east of Old Harmattan that leads underneath it. We’ll attack from through there. The Scourge won’t even know what hit them before it’s too late.
I’ll meet you there, [PlayerName]. Grab your sharpest weapon and let’s get this mess dealt with!
That’s enough debate. Despite the rough state of the project, I feel comfortable with how you’re proceeding, Turnbull. We have details to discuss, but I give you permission to proceed nonetheless.
Well, I’m convinced, Turnbull. This is an exceptional breakthrough. You have the full support of the Academy. There are details to discuss, but overall, you’ve done phenomenal work.
And what, pray tell, do we do about the legitimate horde of Scourge that I know for a fact is bearing down on Harmattan as we speak? We don’t even know where they’re going to attack us from!
They are no doubt taking refuge in the place you call Old Harmattan. The abandoned walled district to the North.
In Old Harmattan? Why there?
Simple. It’s the one place in this accursed plateau that no human is permitted to enter, for fear of disturbing the ghosts. It was the sensible place to hide.

These Scourge are likely led by disciples of the Butcher of Men, planning to attack the city. I will gladly gather my pack to fight them, if you will give me that chance. If they find a foothold here, it may greatly endanger this region’s future.
Wait, Headmaster! We cannot trust an Immaculate to fight its own kind, it will betray us for certain! Allow me to deploy my Golems! Allow me to show you what they are capable of!
No, Victor. I want to see if this Immaculate’s intentions are honest. I will allow him to fight these invading Scourge. Turnbull, send two people to oversee this battle, and report back to me.
[PlayerName], Desy, you know what to do. Keep our friend safe out there.
Never thought I’d be fighting alongside an Immaculate...Against other Scourge. It’s a wild time to be alive.
There is a small cave east of Old Harmattan that leads beneath it. That is the best angle of attack. Meet me through there, humans, as quickly as you can!
This may be a difficult battle, [PlayerName]...Here, take this with you, and prepare yourself as well as you can!
Gah...[PlayerName]? Oh thank Elatt it’s you. I thought I was done for!
Artois? What are you doing here? You’re injured!

Victor sent me to...Provide backup for your...Bah! I’ll be honest, the Wolfgang and I were ordered to plant some explosives during the fight and make sure that no Scourge made it out of Old Harmattan, pacified or not. And then...Gah...I’m such a damned fool...

The Immaculate that Turnbull Pacified...It tried to make the other ones stand down willingly. They refused and attacked us. Your Immaculate...I wouldn’t be here now if he hadn’t tried to protect me...
The hostile Immaculates locked a bunch of the gates in Old Harmattan, to try to split up and corner the pacified ones...Desy and the Wolfgang are still trapped in there with them...
Great, so they need someone to save them, don’t they?
Yeah...Yeah they do. If you can open up the gates and help them kill whatever’s leading these Scourge, you might still be able to win this...Take the key, go...Go try to fix this...
You’re injured! What about you?

Ach...I...I’ll...I don’t know. I drank my last potion after I pulled that damned Corrupted spine out of my gut. I think I’m still bleeding internally. I don’t know how long I have...But maybe it’s better this way. I don’t know if I deserve any other fate...

I should have seen the signs. But I just kept...Playing the hero in my head. Because if I wasn’t on the right side all along, then everything I’d done...I was afraid to face who I’d be if I was actually wrong. And now...I have to accept that I was.
Shut up and take one of my healing potions. You don’t deserve to die like this.
Shut up and take one one of my greater healing potions. You don’t deserve to die.
I...You’d...You’d actually help me? Even if I was actually willing to follow Victor’s orders to ruin everything? Why? By all accounts you have no reason to save me!
He’s a predator who was manipulating you. I blame him, not you.
Even if I won’t forgive you, helping one another is the only way humanity survives.
I...You’re...You’re too kind, [PlayerName]. Thank you. If I survive... I won’t waste this second chance. If not...Tell Desy and your Immaculate that I’m sorry.
As soon as you’re able to move, get back to Harmattan, we’ll catch up later.

No...If I make it out of this alive...I’m not going back to Harmattan. I can’t go back after recognizing that Victor’s been using me all this time. Maybe I’ll...Go home to Berg, who knows. Anywhere’s better than here right now...
You know what, you’re right, I have no reason to help you. You’re on your own.
You’re...Cruel, [PlayerName]. But its no more than I deserve...Go on, people who actually deserve your help are waiting...I’ll...Try to manage on my own...
Shut your yap and get somewhere safe!
I’ll...try. If I don’t...Make it out of this...I’m sorry. Tell Desy and that...That Immaculate that I’m sorry.
Augh...Elatt dammit all, I didn’t want you to see me like this...That’s twice the damned Scourge have gotten the jump on me. My old crew would be ashamed. Has academic life made me soft?!
Desy! Are you alright?

No, I’m not alright! We’d hardly gotten the Golems and mercs into Old Harmattan before we got ambushed by the Scourge. If Henri hadn’t shoved me out of the way of that attack...I might not have made it this far. Artois is still trapped back there with them.

The hostile Immaculates have locked down a bunch of gates to try to corner our forces and split them up for easy killing. I barely managed to get out and lock this door behind me before the horde caught up with me!
Great. I have to try to save them all on my lonesome, then?

Y-yeah, I’ll be no help at this point. I don’t know what you can do to help, but at least try. The Golems are still up and fighting, I think you have a chance to turn this fight around. If you can kill whatever is leading these Scourge, we might still eke out a win.
And what about you?

Me? I’m going to drag myself somewhere safe and try not to die. I’ve got one potion in my bag, and I want to make sure it’s the only one I’ll need. I’ll see you back in Harmattan, if neither of us kicks the bucket in this mess.
Phew...Well, what can I say, I think you might have just saved our lives. Dammit, I hate owin’ people. Especially people that I’m being paid to kidnap and hold for ransom!
Uh...You’re welcome?
Yeah yeah, I know. Here, a little thank you gift. Just keep your yap shut about this around Victor, alright? I’ve seen what happens if you get on his bad side and I never want to end up there.

Maybe in a few years when that old feud blows over, you could come join us in the Wolfgang. You’ve certainly got the talent for it, [PlayerName]. In the meantime, try to stay out of trouble, alright? I’d rather avoid crossing blades with you as well.
I can spare one of these weapons as a gift. Which one suits you better?
I want the Tsar Bow.
I want the Tsar Chakram.

That was a much closer shave that I would have liked. I’m glad to see you weren’t on the wrong side all along, [PlayerName]! We may have taken some unfortunate losses, but at least the Scourge is beaten back once again!
I hope you’re satisfied, Artois.
I am. I know I’m in the right. I know that I’m a good person, serving a noble cause. And at the end of the day, this was a job well done.
Fair enough. This isn’t optimal, but at least Harmattan is safe.
Yes, Harmattan is safe. That’s all that matters. Hopefully someday you’ll open your eyes and see that Victor and I were right about this all along.
Dammit...He’s gone. We were too late to save him. Well...At least he died a hero’s death. That’s some small comfort, at least.
He was a mercenary, he knew the risks he was getting into.
Whatever you say, mate.

Well...The Scourge threat here has been eliminated. Mission complete, I guess. Well, guess we’ll be putting in more orders for the new Golems than we thought. We need all the firepower we can get right now.

Thank you for coming to our aid, huma-...[PlayerName]. I knew it would be unlikely that I could convince disciples of the Butcher to stand aside and change, but I did not expect them to spring their trap so quickly and viciously.

But those in my pack of Kin...They already feel the effects of Turnbull’s counter-spell, just by having stood by me and the runes I bear. For the first time since I awoke as Immaculate, I feel...Hopeful for the survival of our kind.

You may not be a friend to me, [PlayerName], but I recognize your efforts and thank you deeply. Here, consider this a gift. From all those of my kind who will one day be free to choose what to do with their lives, free of their instinctual hate.
What will you do now?

I don’t know what I’ll do. I have many options I must consider...The runes I bear make of me an ambassador between humans and my Scouge Kin. Perhaps I should begin to consider how our species will live in Aurai with our newfound freedom.
Well, I do consider you a friend, Immaculate. I hope we meet again.
...Hah. Then I suppose we are friends, human.
Take my gift and go forth as you have thus far, [PlayerName]. May our paths cross again in the future.
Which of these treasures would bring you joy, then?
...We could not save him. I am...So angry. He led us here with such promises of hope. And it was all for...Hmm...No, perhaps not for nothing.
I feel different. The rage that has always filled my mind is...Quieter now. He was right. Just standing by him today, it was enough to change us as well. Then...Not everything is lost.
Return to Turnbull, human. Tell him that this works. Tell him to free the rest of my kin. Because if this one died for nothing... I will come bring vengeance upon your kind, killing urge or not!
You, however...You, I think, are not bad as far as humans go. There should be more like you, human.

Phew. You showed up just in time, [PlayerName]. Those hostile Scourge were more powerful than anything I’ve faced so far. ...Well, except the Butcher. The Immaculates on our side even felt like they were unprepared for this level of ferocity.

It’s a terrible shame he couldn’t live to see this victory. Even in his death, he proved that Scourgekind not only can be changed for the better, but that they deserve that chance as much as any human does. We’ve made history today, [PlayerName].
I’m glad our Immaculate friend survived this battle. I feel like his voice will be a great one in the years to come. We’ve made history today, [PlayerName].
That we have, Desy. I think we’ve earned a well deserved break, don’t you?
Absolutely. I’m not going outside the walls for a month unless I absolutely have to. This one battle was enough action for quite a while, thanks.
Let’s hope this future we’ve created is a good one...
Hey, no getting cold feet now! Not after this victory! If there’s any complications, we’ll cope with them as they come. We’re good at that!
The taste of victory is sweet. Especially when shared with friends.
Very true. And now we have a few more of those. If you’d have told me a year ago that I would feel this way about Immaculates, I’d have called you a liar. And yet, here we are.
I’ll see you back home in Harmattan, my friend. Until our next mission together, fight safe, fight smart!

It’s such a shame that the Old Theater remains so inaccessible out there in the Antique Plateau. I hear that so many wonderful plays used to be held there back in the day. Not that the nobles cared, they thought it was the lowest form of art.
I wonder...If one tried to approach it from underground...Maybe you could get inside and see if any of Harmattan’s lost culture is still intact over there!
Some of my regulars haven’t shown up in a while...Then again, they were probably outlaws, so maybe that’s for the best.
One said she was trying to fill the boots of the old Fourwinds gang that used to run things in the east of ancient Harmattan. Talk about delusions of grandeur, huh?
With the headmaster back I expected some peace and quiet! *sigh* Your Dean’s theory had better be correct!
Amba, my risk-taking friend! I will be watching this debate with VERY keen interest...
It’s really a shame that Turnbull’s project had to be shelved...But it’s for the greater good.

We’re keeping the success of the Pacification project under wraps for now, until Turnbull finishes the large scale application of the runes. But not long from now, it will be time to make this dream a reality.
You’ve been a credit to the Academy, Initiate. Now, if you’d start turning in some research or a thesis of your own, perhaps we could raise that to Scholar, hmm? *chuckle*
It’s a shame we failed. But...Maybe it’s for the best. Maybe trying to give monsters the chance to redeem themselves was a mistake.
Well, my intentions haven’t changed. I’ll find other ways to support my friends and family in their fight against the Scourge. Harmattan is a place full of opportunity.
Our friend visits nearby from time to time. Would you believe we share a similar taste in books, [PlayerName]? What a time to be alive...
Looks like the region is safe from the looming threat of the Scourge that Turnbull nearly unleashed upon us. Can you imagine the danger that unchained Immaculates would have presented?
I hope you’ve learned from your mistake, [PlayerName]. I know what’s best for Harmattan, for the region, even for you. Can you say you’re happier now, more than you were working for me?
Yes, actually.
Tsk, then you’re still an imbecile. Someday you’ll realize what a fool you were, and that you should never have gotten it into your head to leave my service. But by then, it’ll be too late.
Not really.
Such a shame you did not realize it sooner. Because now it’s too late. After all this, you’re not even worth taking on as an apprentice.
Well, I hope you’re happy with yourself. My tracker Golem project has to undergo massive revision, my reputation has taken a hit, and Artois is missing and presumed dead.
Someday you’ll appreciate all we did.
...One would certainly hope so. Now, get out of my sight.
Still upset that you lost? You can accept you were wrong without being this way.
It’s not about right or wrong. It’s about my well deserved victory being stolen from me. Months of work, sent back to the drawing board. I have every right to be upset at you. Now, shoo!

*sigh* Reasonable people are so hard to find these days...I’m having some difficulty finding more people to handle my business outside of town. I have clients who are getting very impatient about their spice deliveries!
This is going into the history books, that’s for certain. Yet another glorious feather in Sorobor’s cap! It’s a shame that I’m too old to see where all of this will lead...
Well, history doesn’t lie. The Scourge have been nothing but monstrous by nature all this time. Perhaps it’s for the best not to divert the course of history quite so much all at once.
Elatt’s breath, this is an exciting time to be alive! Pacified Scourge! Immaculates who may want to buy our technology! This shakes things up so much I have no idea where to even start!
I’m hard at work on our newest project. Now that those new Golems are entering more wide-scale production, I’ve shunted that onto my Scholars. Let the little people handle the repetitive grunt work!
I’m quite happy that Victor’s been taken down a peg or two. I know that he has been eyeing my position for years. After that debate, I’m more certain than ever he can’t be trusted with it.

It’s a terrible shame that Turnbull’s project was put on hold. Having an entire species owe us the greatest favor of all time, and being open to trade, would have brought in an incredible amount of wealth to the Academy.
That was too much excitement over the past few months. Immaculates, attempted sabotage… This is all quite terrible for the academic reputation of the Academy.
We should be seen as a place of higher learning, not some...Mad scientist’s lab filled with infighting!

I’m on the verge of not just losing my Dean status, but of being outright exiled. Well...Such is life. I won’t hold it against you, but I can’t afford to support you any further. Good luck out there, [PlayerName]. Good luck to us all.

It is a terrible shame that the Immaculate Project was put on hold...But I have hope that someday, we’ll be able to finish the job. Our deal is still good, don’t you worry [PlayerName]. You’re always welcome here at the Arcane branch of Sorobor.
This success goes beyond my wildest dreams. This is a moment that will go down in the history books. My own legacy is all but secured for generations to come.

The headmaster has insisted we take our time ironing out the details of how we’ll mass-deploy the Pacification spell, but we’re making good progress. It won’t be long before we can start spreading it far and wide.
It will be years before the full effects are felt, and several more before we finally see what a truly pacified Scourge horde will look like...But damn, if this doesn’t still feel like total victory.
I couldn’t have done it without you, [PlayerName]. Thank you for all of your support. Even if your name never makes it into the books, rest assured that you’ve had an impact on Harmattan’s history.
Ah. It is good to see you again. I look at these teachings of the Cabal of Winds, and I see structure there. Something that my Kin may need going forward.
Wait, so you’ll start following the Cabal of Wind’s religion?
Perhaps, perhaps not. I merely look for structure to help guide my kind to a way of life that is compatible with humanity. We will see what form that takes.
You know, it’s strange that I can’t call you by any kind of name.
I begin to think...Immaculates have never needed names before. But if we are to deal with humanity more frequently, we may need to adopt this silly custom of yours. Time will tell.
How does it feel, being free?

Like a great weight has been lifted from my shoulders. But in it’s place, I feel a greater sense of responsibility. If I am free, then I must bear the consequences of my decisions without complaint. It is a trade I feel was worth it.
Take care of yourself, friend [PlayerName]. The world is not safe, even with a friend among the Scourge. May our paths cross again.
I cannot believe this talk of pacifying the Scourge! No, peaceful or not, I will NEVER have Scourge stay at my inn! Not in a million years! My customers deserve peace and comfort and clean sheets!

We live in wild times, my friend. And I’m not talking about just Harmattan either. Did you hear? The Queen of Levant has become a goddess! I feel like our world is wildly accelerating towards something, and I can’t help but be nervous.

HARMATTAN! The punishment for your hubris is at hand! The Forge Master demands justice! Long have I languished in the chains Sorobor cast upon me, my sacrifices forgotten, their crimes unpunished! No more!
The wheels of my power are once more in motion! Your ancient factory is bent to my will! Surrender all who serve Sorobor Academy by the end of 60 days, or make your peace with the five winds!
(There is a loud pop as the Golem’s Power Coil purposefully overloads, causing the Golem to collapse before your very eyes)
The wheels of my power are once more in motion! Your ancient factory is bent to my will! Surrender all who serve Sorobor Academy by the end of 100 days, or make your peace with the five winds!
(There’s a glowing Rune inside the Golem’s ribcage...You feel your skin vibrate as you touch the thing...It feels like you’ve been attuned to something...Perhaps new doors will open for you, now.)
(There’s a series of labelled dials inside of the golem’s skull...The signal seems to have come from around the Ancient Bunker, the Ruined Hippodrome, or the Ancient Turbine...)
(Unknown Runes line the doorframe...It would seem the door will not open for you right now...Perhaps some event in the future will give you the means to open it?)
(Unknown Runes line the device...It doesn’t appear to respond to you right now...Perhaps some event in the future will give you the means to use it?)

(There is an ornate key here. The engravings on the handle suggest this is part of a set of 4, and the complex design and precious gemstone on the top suggests it was for something very important...You put it in a hidden pouch for safekeeping.)
Local Rune Train currently de-activated...
(Flip the Switch to “on”)
Re-activating Rune Rail enchantments...Success! Local Rune Train is now active!
The Asset has escaped containment. Quad-Key Lockdown Failsafe Mechanism has been activated. Beware of rogue Golems. Do NOT attempt to rescue anyone trapped inside.
The 4 Gemstone Keys have been inserted into Guardian-Class Golems, separate from the Asset’s control circuit. Keep all keys separate until control has been re-established...
(There are 4 slots for large and complex keys along the device...Each key is likely to be topped with a gemstone, judging by the look of this thing.)
I think these 4 keys I have should work in this device...
Whatever this device is locking up seems quite important...I should find the keys.
(As the final key is inserted, the way forward opens ominously and the booming voice echoes through the halls, even louder than usual)

So...You’ve opened the path to reach me. I hope you’re pleased with yourself, trespasser. Your actions have allowed the Scourge to break into my own inner sanctum. They threaten the very safety of the city that you think you’re saving!

But it won’t matter. I will stop you, I will kill these Scourge, and I will have my vengeance. I can make as many Golems as I want now. Nothing that breathes will escape this place! What gives you the GALL to oppose my righteous fury?!
Someone’s got to try to protect the city from your vendetta!
Hah...Misguided fool. I am SAVING it. Saving it from those madmen who lead Sorobor!
Because I enjoy a challenge. Why do you think I adventure for a living?
Hah...Then you have a death wish. Continue to oppose me, and I will grant it for you!
Just for the inevitable reward. It’s nothing personal.
Greed remains a human value, I see. Well then...Once I’m done with you, I will bury what’s left of your corpse in gold!
Let this be your final warning, trespasser! I am the Forge Master, the Rust Lich! You stand no chance against my immortal power! Flee while I will still allow it!
Select Weapon Loadout for Titanic Guardian Mk-7...
Drilling Sword
Serrated Halberd
10 Ton Hammer
Select Elemental Ward Matrix for Titanic Guardian Mk-7...
Rusted Hive Impact Absorber
Ghostly Wendigo Armor Booster
Obsidian Scourge Repair Matrix
Select Environmental Loadout for Titanic Guardian Mk-7...
Ice Vents
Heat Vents
Corruption Vents
Titanic Guardian Mk-7 Golem settings updated, re-configuration complete...
ERROR, Titanic Guardian currently deployed, modification no longer possible
(As the complex Golem fails and breaks down, various nearby machines shudder to a sudden and final stop...)
No! Don’t...Bah! Very well. You’ve bought Sorobor a stay of execution. But this is merely a setback. I can start over using other sectors of the Factory to produce the means of my revenge.
There’s no need for more violence! Let’s resolve this like reasonable adults!
Have you ANY idea what you ask of me? If YOU had been turned into a monster, enslaved, and imprisoned for century...I doubt very much that mercy and forgiveness would be something you’d consider!
Looks like my job isn’t done, then. I’m coming for you, whatever you are!
Whatever I am?! I am Lord Duvernay, the glorious Forge Master! The last true high lord of Harmattan! You WILL respect me and the authority I wield!
After all that has been done to me, there is no alternative. I WILL have my justice! I will see Sorobor Academy burned to the ground! I will restore the proper order of things!
My demands remain the same! Surrender all who serve Sorobor Academy by the end of 60 days, or reap the consequences!
(As the Scourge Giant collapses, a bunch of the runic projections nearby flicker, vanish, then reappear. Various machines shudder to a stop...And never resume their work.)
Damn you! All my progress, lost! Although, I must also extend my gratitude...

That beast entered this facility with the purpose of destroying it. It crawled though a crack and began to swing its weapons at anything that moved. I feared it would ruin all hope I had of getting justice...

Then again, had this Scourge not tried to destroy this place, it would not have accidentally reactivated my connection to my Phylactery, and let me regain control. In a way, I owe this thing a great debt, even if it was accidental.
So strange that the very monsters I was commanded to destroy have been the source of my freedom not once, but twice...Perhaps this is a sign...
Your purpose was to fight the Scourge?

Did you think that these Golems could wage war against the hordes of Scourge all by themselves? No. I controlled them. I am the one who saved Harmattan all those years ago...And what was my reward for my sacrifice? To be buried here, forgotten!
You plan to ally with the Scourge, then?

Hah, perhaps. Whatever lets me once more take my rightful place as a ruler of Harmattan and take my revenge. After all I sacrificed for the city...I deserve more than to be buried here and forgotten like this!

And in my absence...The other great lords of Harmattan fled like cowards, died like cowards, and let that damnable Sorobor Academy create a city where our accomplishments and legacies were all but erased!
(Lethal levels of Corruption are coming from nearby vents... You must eliminate the source if you want to proceed!)

(The Scourge Giant seems to still be breathing! But the skin has solidified to the point where further damage is impossible. The creature is still alive, in some form of deep hibernation...At least in this form, it’s no threat...)
Not one step further, you vile, ignorant fool! In the name of the old lords, I, Lord Duvernay, command you to leave!
You can’t order me around. I’m coming for you!
Sounds like I’m getting near the source of the trouble. Time to end this!
Please reconsider already! We don’t have to kill each other!

You cannot understand my suffering, the injustice that I suffered! I was a noble, once. Of a powerful and storied house. Not once in the history of Harmattan did we lose our place on the ruling council. Even during the Scourge, I stayed to guide our people!

And then those bastards from the Academy ripped my very heart from my chest, poured liquid metal in its place and chanted profane spells upon me! My soul was ripped from me and imprisoned in a device of gears and springs!

They made me their prisoner, their slave! They turned me into this...This monstrous creature, a Lich, against my will! They used me, treated me like a tool, and saw to it that my entire legacy would be erased from history!

But no more. No! More! I will send wave after wave of Golems to the city and bring Sorobor to its knees! And then I will take my rightful place as lord of the city, and as a hero who fought the Scourge!
Turn back now, or die! I am an immortal Lich, far beyond anything a human is capable of! You stand no chance of victory! Flee if you value your fragile life!
I’ve fought a Lich already. You don’t scare me.
Oh, have you? If you think you can crush me, I dare you to try! I’ve had nearly one hundred years to plan my vengeance, a small annoyance like you will be no trouble!
Someone needs to put you in your place. I’m going to stop you.
Then YOUR place is a forgotten grave in this accursed maze of metal and smoke. Die and begone!
Then there’s no point in talking anymore, is there?
There never was, mortal. After all I’ve suffered, I cannot turn away from my path. Try to stop me, and you will face my judgment as well!
You...Have...Not...Won! ...I will return. I am immortal. I am the Forge Master! The Rust Lich! All you do is delay the inevitable...

(There is a glowing Golem Gearbox here, vibrating with intense power...This must be the Rust Lich’s Phylactery. The legends say that if a Phylactery is destroyed, the Lich it belongs to will become mortal again...)
...Maybe I should leave it here...He doesn’t deserve to die.

(You leave the Phylactery be. You will likely need to keep coming back to stop the Lich from time to time, but he will live on. All you can do is hope that your act of mercy leaves an impression on him...)
This Lich needs to die. Let’s break this damn thing!

(You press the ominous red button labelled with a skull. An explosion rocks the container, sending gears and springs flying about inside. An agonized scream fills the room, echoing through your very blood...Then silence.)
You...You monster...My immortality...My life...You’ve ripped it from me...
I did nothing wrong...Nothing you would not have done. Over a century of torment, enslavement, imprisonment...No one would have done any different.
You chose this path, Lich. You have no right to complain about the consequences.
Yes, I would have done different. Don’t pretend you know me, Lich.
I’m sorry it came to this. But you gave me no other option. I had to protect Harmattan.
Then end me already...Inflict your damnable false justice on me...I regret nothing...
I’ll deal out justice myself!
Then either kill me now, or walk away...I cling to life by a thread as it is.
I’ll see you face justice for your crimes. I’m turning you over to the guards.

Thanks for turning him in, [PlayerName]. Considering his condition... I don’t know how much time there will be for a trial, but...We’ll damn well try. Please go see the Headmaster of Sorbor Academy, he’ll want to speak with you about this!
I killed the Rust Lich that was threatening the city.
Yes, I’m aware. There was quite an impressive spike in local Mana when you destroyed his Phylactery. That must have been some fight he put up.
I wish it hadn’t come to his death. I don’t approve of what was done to him by our forefathers. It was a good idea, implemented wrongly...But I do understand why they did it.
Why would the Soroboreans from a hundred years ago DO that to him?

The old elected nobles not only more or less rigged the elections to ensure power never truly slipped away from them, but Lord Duvernay was one of the worst. I suspect he didn’t care if people used as Golem commanders were actual volunteers or not.

From what I understand, he was the only noble who didn’t hide away in what is now Old Harmattan when the Scourge hit...But he thought that fact gave him the right to command everyone else, regardless of their consent, and regardless of the harm.
In the end...I suppose that makes his punishment fit his crimes.
Will you tell the citizens the truth about what happened?

I don’t see how we can, without causing serious and unnecessary harm to Sorobor’s reputation, or without seriously unbalancing our understanding of history. I’m afraid it’s for the best if the full truth remains buried, at least in the official sense.
You have earned a great reward for your deeds, [PlayerName]. Put it to good use. Thank you, for putting these ancient crimes to rest.
It’s only unfortunate that you weren’t able to stop this before he attacked the city. Thank you for putting these ancient crimes to rest.

You know, I wonder how they used to control the old Golems we used to fight the Scourge. I feel like a full-on war would require more precise control than the simple control methods we use these days.
Well, if there is any truth to that, it’s likely buried somewhere in all those ruins out there. I can only wait until someone uncovers it and lets me know.
That Golem...I can’t help but worry about what he said...Was that Golem alive? Was someone controlling it? ...And...What did Sorobor DO to anger it so?
Oof...We should not have disregarded that Golem’s weird ranting. About a dozen rogue Golems came bursting into the town from a hidden wall and laid into anyone near the Academy plaza!
One of those...Weird peaceful Immaculates that Turnbull was working on managed to fend them off. Saying thank you to a Scourge Beast was...Not something I thought I’d ever have to do!
If some of Victor Berthelot’s new, empowered Golems hadn’t been prowling the plaza...I shudder to think how many people would have been slaughtered.

They managed to kill a few unfortunate souls before the Engineering Dean shot them with some kind of lightning gun. He said it “de-charged” their power coils or something. I don’t care how he did it, I’m just glad to be alive!
I saw the execution of that Lich that threatened our town...Poor creature. I think it might have even been dead before the executioner did his work...
I hear some brave adventurer destroyed the Lich that threatened Harmattan! Whoever they were must have been quite skilled. A furious Lich is absolutely terrifying to behold!
I have faith in the designs of the Golems. They can take a lot of punishment and really dish it out too. What give me pause is the control mechanism, sir.

It jacks raw Mana intake directly into the puppeteer and keeps them comatose the entire time... This WILL kill anyone who controls the things for more than a few weeks, especially if they do not take frequent breaks.

I understand that we need total control, and that the old command methods won't hold up. But we don't have enough people to keep throwing into that meat grinder. We can't keep grabbing people from the Lower Habitation district, it's not sustainable!

Please, I beg of you. Listen to Lord Duvernay’s idea about making someone who CAN handle the command mechanism long term...I know it seems like a long shot, but it's the best shot we have. I’ll even volunteer if I have to!
It pains me to see my fancy designs put through such rapid, careless production. But at least I can be glad that, bastardized or not, my Golems are saving the region.

We're just about tapped out of the local iron and palladium we need to keep up production, and with the rune train rails cut off as they are, we can no longer import what we need. If we don't break this siege soon, what's left of Harmattan is finished.

I've heard rumors of some powerful being emerging from Monsoon, an actual god, they say. All I can do is hope that it's true and that they send us help. Because nothing short of divine intervention is going to break this stalemate at this point.

I feel so much better using Troglodytes as live targets. The animals did nothing wrong, but Trogs? They're nasty mushroom monsters. Do they even count as living things? I consider them angry plants with teeny little brains, honestly.
It also helps that they reproduce real quick. We have an endless stream of them coming out of that tunnel. Our downtime between testing phases is now effectively zero.

It's also helpful that they're puny enough to pose no real threat to the lab. Seriously, even if they send a pack of Trog Knights at us, our Golems can make short work of them. If that's the strongest they can throw at us, we have nothing to worry about.

I’ve managed to stabilize the Mana flow again. This is the maximum we can use to charge the Golems without risking the total collapse of the Ley Line...And yet, we still can't meet the demands of our Golem army.

If only we were able to ask for help from the Electric Lab in the Abrassar Plains...We're going to have to send Golems out with less than maximum power, and hope that this is enough...And that extended maximum usage doesn't cause a leak.
Those tall Scourge creatures who wield weapons...The Corruption seems to have done more than just mutate them from some animal... They are intelligent, powerful, unyielding in the face of death.
They know no fear, and feel no pain. These monsters appear to almost be designed to be perfect killing machines. They are, in a word, “Immaculate”.
I cannot avoid the conclusion that they must have once been human. Winds forgive us, and punish whomever did this to them, inflicting them upon us all. Nothing could have been worth this.

These “Sublime Shells” as we call them...They are far closer to the jungle apes that the “Shell Horror” species seem to be corrupted from... But even smarter. Some of them appear to even be capable of (extremely) limited speech...

“Illuminators”...They puzzle us all. They appear to be like mobile plants, with no head or mouth to speak of...But their feet...They’re shaped like human hands... Even the “Pure Illuminators” follow no sensible biology and appear to be strange amalgams...

These “Grotesques”...They are similar to Immaculates. But they lack intelligence of any kind, and hew closer to the plantlike Illuminators...Are they failed Immaculates? Or are Immaculates a superior version of the Grotesque?

Whoever was inspecting the Asset’s containment chamber before me was not performing the full checklist. I found at least 6 potential safety violations that could lead to a breach. Half the bolts on the Mana intake pipe are rusted!

I strongly urge you to sign off on immediate quarantine of the area until these issues are patched up and the Asset is moved to a containment chamber with ZERO metal! Make the pipes out of glass if you have to!

The Asset’s entire domain of power is over metal and machines! I understand that he is our only hope of fending off the Scourge, but if we do not take action immediately, we risk this immortal superhuman breaking free and slaughtering us all!
(The head supervisor’s signature is only half-completed. Something must have interrupted him...)

I’m trapped in here. That bastard let the Scourge tunnel into the place and catch us off guard. We didn’t realize our Golems had turned on us until it was too late. It’s only a matter of which kills me first, the Golems, or the Scourge.
I can still hear them fighting each other in here...Even with the factory shut down, the Golems continue to follow their last orders...And with all the exits sealed, there’s no way out for me...
All I can can do is catalogue the extensive list of horrible decisions that lead to this mess, so we won’t make the same mistakes agai-...
Report: Every dissection of expired Golem Puppeteers is the same. The process of controlling the Golems inevitably leads to such Mana overdose that it causes complete organ failure.
Please inform the commander to stop asking me to perform these dissections. It is a waste of time. We will gain no new information.

Attempt 1: Focal point – Mana Stone, Failure. The attempt to create a “Mana Lich” was a complete botch. Their organs completely burned to a crisp. I am unsure if it was a failure of the ritual, or if Mana is too general a focal point to create a Lich.

Attempt 5: Focal Point – Golem Gearbox, Failure. Even with the alterations to the ritual, the volunteer did not become a Lich. I think it was a failure of the subject, not the ritual, nor the focal point. The subject needs to be of stronger will...

Lord Duvernay flew into a rage at our failures, threatening to use US in the next ritual if we don’t turn out results. Winds-damned idiot. I don’t care if he’s the only noble who didn’t abandon the city, Harmattan would be better off without that fool.
In fact, if he’s so insistent on turning someone into a Lich, he should be the next “volunteer”!

Attempt 6: Focal Point – Golem Gearbox, Success! Who knew that Lord Duvernay had it in him! Then again, the self-righteous bastard is now an immortal, magically imbued creature with full control over our Golem army. This may not be an improvement.

For now, his sense of duty to protect Harmattan keeps him in line, but I have no doubt that the moment he sees his chance, he will slaughter us all for what we did to him against his will. We need failsafes. Lots of ‘em.

Success! The Lich can control the Golems just by keeping his Phylactery inside a control unit. At the suggestion of an aide, we’ve agreed to keep the Lich in an isolated containment unit, far away from his Phylactery.
He makes an awful racket in there, but so long as we keep it properly maintained and the Mana flow to the internal barrier spell steady, we should be able to keep him in check.

Finally, if the worst should happen, our failsafe will shut down the entire factory, and disrupt the connection between him and his Phylactery. Theoretically, this should prevent him from controlling the Golems or even moving his own body until we regain control...
“Theoretically” isn’t enough for me, but it’s all we have. All we can do now it hope we never have to flip that switch...
(This disabled Golem’s 3 Power Coils are broken and leaking... You could easily replace them... But...Something about this golem fills you with grave concern...)
(Use 3 Power Coils to fix it)
(The Golem’s gears whirr to life! For a moment, nothing happens, then suddenly a dial spins to point at “RECEIVING SIGNAL”. The Golem leaps to it’s feet and shoves you aside!)
Thank you, [PlayerName]! I won’t forget this! Here, have a little something in return!
The best food in Aurai, right here! From the Chersonese coast, to the Impasse mountains!
Need help with anything?
I’m running a little low on Manaheart Bass...Be a dear and bring me 2 of them, would you, please?
Tools and gear, fit for hunting beast or Scourge! If it’s good enough for the warriors at the Gates of Catharsis, it’s good enough for you!
My Daughter’s been asking me for a Tourmaline for a while. If you came across some, I’d be most grateful!
It’s a harsh world out there! Be prepared for anything, with our excellent selection of camping equipment!
I’ve heard tell of a delicious desert called Angel Food Cake! I’d love to try it, but I haven’t found anyone willing to share!
Whatever ails you, I can cure it. Whatever you’re fighting, I can tell you how to poison it. Either way, you’re in good hands with me!
Weapons, made for the most serious of adventurers! Buy one, it’s dangerous to travel alone!
I was asked to make a weapon out of a Shield Golem Scrap for someone, but it’s so hard to source... If you happen across some, I’d reward you well for it!
The best defense is a good defense! What good’s a sword if you can’t live long enough to swing it?
I’m trying to add some enchantments to something special I’m working on. If you happen across any Fire Elemental Particles out there, I’d trade for them!

Ah, wait...I’m afraid I can’t serve you. Your name’s on my list of blacklisted customers. The Mercantile Provost, Sekiguchi Meiko, has a note here saying that until you work something out with her, you can’t shop here. Sorry!
Support your local merchants! Homegrown food from right here in Harmattan!
Oh? A Customer? Excellent! Please, take your time! Elatt knows I’ve got so much of it these days...
Want something made with care and attention, not just imported from abroad? Then do the smart thing and buy from me!
Looking for magical items and tools? I’ll give you the student’s discount!
Welcome to the Victorious Light! If you’re a traveller who wants only the best comfort, you are in the right place!
Want us to look after you, then? Our lovingly stocked rooms are 30 silver a stay!
This here’s the Citizen’s Barracks! If’n you need a place to lay your head for a night, you’ll find no cheaper place in Harmattan!
You’re welcome to stay the night, mate. The rate’s 15 silver for one night of room and board.

The Blue Chamber Collective doesn’t really believe in the death penalty. The maximum sentence is usually exile, with the understanding that returning will be met with lethal force. That’s not so, here in Harmattan.

It wasn’t the case even back in the old days. The ancient council of nobles felt exile didn’t send a strong enough message. So, the death penalty for high crimes have stayed a tradition here even after the Scourge, regardless of effectiveness.
“Antique Plateau”, hah. Such an insult. People literally only call it that because the ruins of our great city scatter the entire length of the place.

Less than a century ago, all of the region was known as Harmattan. Now, it’s as if our great legacy has been condensed down to just this one district we call a city. This treatment is disgraceful, I tell you!

People have forgotten, we were one of the earliest regions hit by the Scourge, and we held off the greater bulk of the horde from pouring into western Aurai. People like to give Elatt all the credit for stopping them, and while there is truth to that...
If we hadn’t held the damn things off for as long as we did, there wouldn’t have been much of an Aurai for him to save, dammit!

Train you, huh? Do you really think you have what it takes to learn the Prismatic Flurry? It asks you to bend magical boons with your fists, truly a merging of the physical and the spiritual. Only a few people are capable of it.
If you want me to teach you, prove to me your body can handle it. Return and show me a piece of Pure Chitin from an enhanced Scourge Beast, and I will believe you are capable!
Elatt’s breath, you actually did it. Alright. Let’s begin...
Hah! You’ve got it! It’s been ages since I’ve seen someone else use that technique without collapsing from the strain! You have no idea how happy you’ve made me today, [PlayerName]!

Berg? Pfft, that old pile of stones was nothing compared to us. Everything was on track for us to become the new heart of the Collective. We even had our own Blue Chamber ready! Then the damn Scourge had to ruin everything...
By the way...You and I have something to discuss. You are aware I paid your ransom, securing your release from the Wolfgang, yes?
I want to be repaid. Not in money. I want something more valuable than mere silver. Tell me, [PlayerName], have you ever hunted a Boozu before? Those large hulking mammals on the Plateau?

They are considered a sort of “protected species”, due to how their bodies break down natural Corruption. Kill one and bring me at least one piece of Boozu’s Hide. Only then will I allow you to visit the marketplace again.
Ah. Excellent. Consider your debt to me repaid. I will have your name removed from the market’s blacklist, effective immediately.
Don’t let this happen again. If you do, however...We’ll find a similar arrangement. You will need to earn your right to the market again. Understand?
(If you reported this back to one of the Provosts or the Headmaster back at Sorobor Academy in Harmattan, there would likely be a sizeable reward...)
I found evidence that someone from Sorobor was involving in kidnapping and murder.
Let me see that...Oho! VERY interesting. Yes, this will be quite profitable. Hand the evidence over to me, and I’ll see to it that everyone in the central market gives you a discount. Permanently.
And what about the culprit?

I’m going to work that Nanzome, that Black-Heart, to the bone for the rest of his life. He knows that if the headmaster ever found out, he would likely “disappear”. It wouldn’t be the first time that happened to a traitor to the ideals of the Academy.
Deal, here’s the evidence!
...I think someone else might give me a better deal. I’ll think about it.
VERY good business, [PlayerName]. Now, if you’ll excuse me, I have a kidnapper to extort.
Oh, and that ransom repayment I have you working on? You’re off the hook this time.

What?! If this proof checks out, this is a huge deal. Sorobor’s reputation would take a considerable blow from this scandal... Hand the evidence over to me and I’ll open up my private shop of discount potions to you in exchange.

If he wants to play with Immaculates so badly, there are some very dangerous jobs we need done around the Gates of Catharsis. He can choose between doing those, or having his crimes made public and finding himself dangling from a scaffold.
A wise decision. I will see to it that he either redeems himself the long and difficult way, or dies in the process. Either one suits my mood. I’ll remember this, [PlayerName], don’t you worry.
So, what kind of potions would you like? They’re 40 Silver per set.
Defensive Set
Aggressive Set
Mage Set
What? Let me see...Ah, Jager. What have you done? Give me this proof, and I will see justice done. All of Sorobor Academy will owe you a great debt for your actions.

A bounty will be put on his head for these murders. Whether he is slain in the field like a common bandit, or dragged back here in chains to face justice properly, I care not. There will be no blood price, only his death, for such unethical behaviour.

The rest of the world must know that Sorobor Academy will not tolerate the use of mass kidnapping and murder as a tool of research. I will not have such a black mark on our reputation, after we have done so much to secure our prominence.
Sorobor is in your debt, [PlayerName]. I will not forget it. I will be sure to repay the favor, if someday you are ever in great need.

I do not regret giving up decades of mortal vitality to the Ley Line. After all, there is plenty of life to take from my foes. Sit down, and I’ll teach you to tap into the negatives of magic, the art of Hexes!
You scoff at my appearance, but one training session with me could change your life! I’ll teach you to strike like lightning, and evade with the grace of a butterfly! Now put ‘em up!
(A skeleton lies here...It almost looks like something shed it like a coat and emerged from it...A sense of hunger lingers around it...A hunger for raw meat...)
(Offer a piece of raw meat to the Skeleton...)

(As you place the offering in the ribcage, a line of painful frost shoots up your arm, and towards your heart, filling you with a dreadful chill. You feel like the world itself has warned you “Go no further, or face the consequences...”)

Hey, have you ever met a man named Gep? See...Months ago, I was ambushed and brought down by a Shell Horror. I thought it was all over...But then I woke up next to a roaring campfire, safe and sound, with a note from this Gep fellow...
