*Sigh* I don’t know who he really is, but I owe him my life. And that’s something I’ll never forget. Sometimes, it feels like it was a fever dream. I wish I had more proof he was real...
Oh! I have one of those notes too! He was gone before I woke up too.

You do?! Let me see...You too! I...I have only more questions. Who is he?! I...I just want to repay him for saving my life, and yet no matter who I ask, no one has actually seen the man! It’s infuriating!
Maybe he doesn’t actually want thanks and is just that kindhearted.

Probably...But it just makes me want to meet him even more now. At the very least, I owe him a drink. Whatever he wants, whether it’s tea, or wine or just a bowl of Pearlbird soup. The man’s my personal hero.
Maybe he’s a ghost or a wandering spirit...

I...I don’t think so. Ghosts would have trouble carrying us to safety for such distances, let alone lighting a fire...Then again, maybe I just don’t want this to be true because I don’t want to imagine him wandering, trapped in his memories as an undead ghost...
...Hmm...Why not pay it forward? Why not do like Gep, yourself?

I hadn’t considered that. Does this strange legend exist to urge us all to help one another, and ask for no thanks in return? But then...Who started it? Who was the original Gep who extended a helping hand? ...I want to meet him even more now...
*Sigh* I don’t know if I’ll ever find the truth. But I’ll drink to him all the same. There need to be more Geps in the world.
Ah, yes. I can teach you the power of the Scorching Touch. Enemies touched by this hex will find themselves further vulnerable to the power of your flames. Pay me 50 silver and it’s yours.

Excellent. It’s quite simple. Picture a roaring fire, and concentrate your mana into the palm of your hand until you feel like it’s stinging in pain. One strong strike will pass that on into your foe’s entire nervous system. See? Simple.
Welcome to Harmattan, home of Sorobor Academy! Behave yourself, we will tolerate no violent crime here! We didn’t survive the worst of the Scourge just to let troublemakers do as they please!
North of town, you’ll find Golem Lake and Old Harmattan. Don’t try to get in there, we’ve sealed it off to keep the ghosts trapped inside. If they got out, they could seriously endanger the region!

To the East, there’s the ruined cultural district, and just north of that is what was once known as the Fourwinds District, where that old gang once held power. It’s mostly wild animals and Golems around there nowadays.
To the South, there’s the Vigil crystal in the old merchant’s district. And to the East of that you’ve got the old Cabal of Winds temple and the Mana Lake.

To the West, there’s a few outlaw gangs trying to displace the Wolfgang Mercenaries. Be careful wandering into any of the ruined districts over there. You may find friends, or you may find a great deal of foes. Check, before you attack!
Anything I should be careful about out there?

Be wary of clouds of Corruption out there! The damage left by the Scourge was bad enough that even a century later, much of it has yet to fade. Exposure to too much malignant Corruption will leave you terribly ill.
Keep your eyes peeled for large Scourge Beasts and malfunctioning Golems. We’ve heard reports of a Wendigo prowling about the South as well. Steer clear of them all unless you’re very well prepared.
There are far too many to name, I’m afraid. You’ll find most of the important people either up in Sorobor Academy, around the central marketplace, or in the Military District on the east side.

There are two inns in town that are good places to pick up recent gossip. One’s up on the West side of town, the other’s lower on the east side, near Justice Plaza. As for water, there’s a drinking basin by the Marketplace.

I’m sorry, this area is closed...Some Scourge erupted from a crack in a nearby alley, and rampaged through the city...The interior of this building is completely trashed. No one managed to get out in time, either... Poor souls...
Free...Me...!
What the...Voices in my head!
Minions...They gather blood...Keep me immortal...Kill them...Kill...Them...! Reward...You...
(The image of a stone gazeebo floats into your mind...)
(You see a flash of a windmill up on a cliff...)
(A crumbling temple appears in your mind’s eye...)
(You are gripped by the thought of a fortress barracks...)
(The shriveled, twisted corpse of this old blood mage has a look of relief etched onto their face...)
(A sudden shudder fills you, as forbidden knowledge leaks into your brain...)

Success! I have discovered the secret to immortality via blood magic. At last, a way to stay alive, without forsaking my humanity! I will share this gift with my apprentices, it should ensure they remain unquestioningly loyal to me.

There is a problem...The longer I live...The more Corruption grows within me. Fortunately, my minions bring me the blood that I need to keep it at bay...But I was wrong about their loyalty...This requires more...Direct control...

I was a fool. Yes, I am immortal so long as I perform the ritual when needed, but every time that I do, the Corruption spreads in me faster and faster. My human body is dying faster than I can give it new life...My minions can barely keep up anymore...
Hey there! The owner of this house just moved to Monsoon, and has put the place up for sale! It’s yours if you want it, friend!
I have a little something I can teach you. The Doom Hex primes your foe to take considerably more damage from lightning. I’m feeling charitable, how does 50 silver sound?
Good. Now, pay attention...Use your magic to generate a little ball of static between your thumb and ring finger and then-
-There, just like that! The effect of that static will make them quite vulnerable to additional shocks!

Yes, I could teach you the Haunt hex. I use a summoned ghost to protect me when I need to venture outside, and this hex makes my foes even more vulnerable to his ethereal attacks! I’ll teach you for 50 silver!
Deal! So, what you do is focus your Mana, and “puncture” the outside of your foe’s soul, causing it to leak a little bit, then-
-There! Exactly right! It's also helpful when using conjured runic weapons and traps too!
Ah, glorious Harmattan! It’s good to be home again!
Take me to {1} – {2} – {3}
You should tell your travelling companion to get closer. I can’t give you a lift if you’re not all here!
I’m afraid I’m not travelling anywhere at the moment.
Very well. I’ll be here if you need me!
I want to travel with you.
*tsk* I’m afraid you don’t have the money or rations. I’m sorry, friend, but I can’t do this for free.
Sure, I can give you a lift, for a small fee. And you’ll need to handle your own rations.
I hate this accursed region...It is so full of blood and pain...But it bears so much significance to both our species...And so, I visit from time to time, so I never forget.
I have no special gifts for you, friend. But...Allow me to freely share some knowledge with you instead.
(You feel a strange surge of wind blow through you. The Wind in the Antique Plateau region recognizes you and will obey you if you command it)
I’ve done what you asked!
Wearing more enchantments may activate this magic circle…
There are 5 Tourmaline-shaped slots here…
Only someone fully Alert may enter here…
The North exits are closed for the moment, visitor. Repairs are being done to Old Harmattan’s walls, and we can’t risk any ghosts slipping into the city proper!
Bring me some Shield Golem Scraps and I can make you some Antique Garb, like the guards wear.
Helmet (1 Shield Golem Scrap, 200 silver)
Armor ( 1 Shield Golem Scrap, 400 silver)
Boots (1 Shield Golem Scrap, 200 silver)

Even with the Vigil directly on top of the great Scourge tunnel, and even with the thing entirely flooded, I suspect the Scourge are still using splinter tunnels to get around the region. We need a better way to track the beasts...

My studies of the Vigil Crystal...They lead me to believe that the Scourge have an innate connection to the realm of dreams...Sleeping near a Vigil often leads to horrendous nightmares...I suspect the same may be the case for sleeping Scourge...

3rd Late Autumn: The Scourge are beating down the flimsy barricades. The Golems are barely able to hold them off. There is little food, and no rescue in sight, though Upper Harmattan is just a few strides away.
I know the legend. That to partake of human flesh will bring down the wrath of all life. But my choices are starve, or take my chances that the legend is just that. A legend. The choice is obvious.

2nd midwinter: Rescue still not coming. Scourge are still roaming at our barricades. Timothy gave me odd looks at our turn on watch. He said it was freezing cold, and asked why I was not bundled in furs.
I told him that I was not cold at all, and Jenna needed my furs more. In fact...I have not felt cold at all this winter...I worry that Timothy suspects...

12th Midwinter: The legend is a sham. While everyone rations the last few rotten bread loaves and salted meat, or chokes on poisonous scourge flesh in desperation, I am full and strong, feeding just on the fallen alone.
In fact, I have never felt stronger. Never more keen and alert. Even if Timothy suspects me...What can anyone do? They are frail, starved, weak. I am strong. I am predator, they are-

18th Midwinter: The beast is coming. I can hear it coming for me. It's clawing through the walls, it's screaming for my blood, it will devour me, I cannot get out I cannot get away I cannot stop it kill it killitkillit-
20th Midwinter: (There are 6 deep gouges on the page, almost like tally marks...)

LocalizationEntryHolder.Value: Pain wracks your body as you wake up from your injury. Your foes have left you for dead, but linger nearby. With intense effort and sheer desperation, you manage to drag yourself back to the entrance to this place, where you fall unconscious once more.

It is hours before you regain consciousness. You are beaten and bloody, but alive. You will wear these scars for quite some time...You curse your recklessness and vow to be more prepared for danger in the future.

You fall to the ground, broken and defeated. As you start to black out from the pain, you sense someone standing above you, defending you! A warm voice reaches you through the haze of pain. "Whoa there, now! It ain't your time to die today. Stay with me, I'll look after you."

Stars and campfires dance in your fevered mind. Your eyes flutter open and you find yourself someplace safe. A warm campfire roars nearby, a note and mysterious bottle propped up beside it. You are alone, but you feel like someone was just here a moment ago...

You raise you arms, shielding your vulnerable throat from the animals that howl at you, and brace yourself for death...Fangs sink into your leg and you feel yourself dragged across the ground. Every rock and bump causes jolts of pain that knock you into darkness for a while...
When you finally come to and open your eyes, you see the half-eaten leg of some poor explorer inches from your face. Hyenas howl nearby, hungry for flesh. Clearly, dinner has been served!

You wake from unconsciousness to see a bandit tying your hands together, and chaining you to a line of other prisoners. A lash from a whip stings your arm as you are ordered to run through the night. Your captors run you and the others ragged until their camp finally enters your vision...

The miserable cries of your fellow prisoners fill the air as you are shoved into iron cages, and left to stew in total darkness. You get to work on forcing the bolts off the prison door. It’s hard work, but eventually you succeed. It’s time to make your escape!

You fall to the ground, broken and defeated. As you start to black out from the pain, you sense something standing above you, defending you. A cold voice reaches you through the haze of pain. "Are you alive? Answer me!"
You awaken hours later, underground. As you lift up your head, a shape moves in the corner of your eyes. It is a monstrous beast that walks on two legs, red pulsing veins running along its body.
The creature must have saved you! You see it holding a book in its hands, as it lets out a quiet laugh. Your consciousness fades again for a few minutes, before you manage to get up.

Hours later, you awake to find yourself in a small hovel with an old man smoking a pipe, who smirks at you. "You lack Reason. Be thankful for the Wind of Kindness, for it bore me to you in your time of need. Perhaps more care in the future will do you good, hmmm?"
You can’t stand anymore, the very act of breathing is becoming difficult. Pain wracks your body as your consciousness fades…
The warm smells of Cierzo's inn greet you. It seems someone found you on the edge of death and nursed you back to health. You have been out cold for days, though at the least you're still alive...

You awaken to the sight of a huntress from Cierzo pouring water into your mouth. Leaning on her, you manage to hobble back to Cierzo, more dead than alive. She refuses payment and leaves you with a firm pat on the shoulder.

You wake up to see a bandit tying your hands together, and chaining you to a line of other prisoners. A lash from a whip stings your back as you are ordered to run through the night. Your captors run you ragged until their camp finally enters your vision...

A wave of nausea from the death march you were forced to make rises from your stomach, and you vomit onto the cold hard ground, before falling into your own mess. By the time you get back up, you are alone. They seem to have no use for sick prisoners...

You force your eyes open and find yourself in a cart with prisoners and corpses, bouncing along the road. A corpse hanging from a gibbet passes your vision...As unconsciousness takes you, you know that you have been taken prisoner by the Montcalm Tribe...
Hours later you open your eyes again, imprisoned within the Montcalm Village. You have no doubt they intend for your corpse to join the others dangling outside!
Pain wracks your body as you wake up from your injury. You are alone, but surely not safe. With clenched teeth, you manage to drag yourself outside to safety, where you fall unconscious again.

You awake from the verge of death, corpses piled on top of you. With great effort, you pull yourself free, and find yourself outside rough wooden walls. The Montcalm tribe appear to have mistaken you for dead...

Your eyes open to the sight of a Kazite woman pointing a sword right between your eyes. You are in no state to resist as she binds your hands and blindfolds you, and forces you to march. You hear bandit activity loud all around you.

Your captor boots you into a cell and slams cold iron bars behind you. "Here's how it goes slave! Work when we tell you to, and you’ll get food and water. Or refuse to work, and it's to 'The Hole' with ye!"

Without the strength to fight, you can only watch helplessly as Troglodytes surround you, chittering in their barbaric language, and haul you through their cave. The foul smell of rotting meat fills your nostrils as they dump you into a large, well lit room.

Troglodytes gather around a large stone pot over a fire, sometimes staring at you hungrily. Suddenly, a noise echoes in the cave and the monsters freeze. The dimwitted creatures then grab spears and charge out, leaving you alone.

Your body and mind are broken, all that's left is to await the release of death...Strange purple auras swirl around you and you give yourself to them, riding a strange dreamlike current, passing stars and ghostly figures...

It is the dull aches that wake you. The magical auras are not gone, but now you can sense their source. You are in the central chamber below the Conflux Mountain, in the care of the Watchers of the Ley Line...

Defenceless, you cannot stop the approach of the ghostly figure that bears down on you. It speaks to you in a language you cannot recognize, but the intention is clear - do not resist! It grabs your arm and drags you through the Ghost Pass, sword ready if you try to escape...

Your journey ends at a broken old cell whose door has long since fallen away. The ghost drops your arm, and turns away, motioning to slam the long-gone door into place and twisting a "key" into the air, before marching away.

The sign on the cell is in the Old Language, but it's easy enough to guess that it reads "marked for execution". You thank your lucky stars that the ghost was trapped in its old memories, unable to reason and think...

You awake to the familiar scent of your old home at the Lighthouse in Cierzo, warm and tucked into your bed, your backpack propped up beside you. Someone must have brought you back home and nursed you back to health. You’re not sure how long you’ve been unconscious...

When your eyes open, you find yourself wrapped up in a bed at the inn in Berg, having been unconscious for days. The innkeeper has helped himself to your Silver to pay for your stay, but you are otherwise alive and healthy.

When you next awake, you are being carried by a hunter from Berg, on his way back to the city. He lets you down gently at the city gates with a gruff “Watch yourself out there, you were nearly a manticore’s dinner!”

You awaken wrapped in silk sheets at Levant’s inn, apparently having been nursed back to health after several days. The treatment and food has not come cheap either, judging by how light your coin pouch has become. Well, you live to fight another day!

It is pure luck that brings a mercenary company to your aid. To your relief, his band brings you back safely to the gates of Levant, free of charge. They then go off merrily to the inn, clearly going to brag to the serving girls about how they saved your life and didn’t even ask for payment...
You wake up in the marsh. The Ash Giants, not knowing what to do with your unconscious body, dumped you outside their village. You can’t help but feel a little miffed at this rude treatment.

The smell of sweet incense greets you as you awaken from the fevered dreams of the last few days. A passing missionary must have brought you to the Inn in Monsoon. The innkeeper has used money from your own pouch to pay for your treatment, but at least you’re still alive.
As your eyes open, you find yourself propped up against a wall at the gates of Monsoon, safe. As you glance around for your saviour, you see someone in gleaming white armor vanish into the crowd...

Unconsciousness comes quickly, and you dream of being ensnared in something. With a yelp, you jump out of your bed. Relief floods you as you recognize where you are. You are back in your old bed at home, the Lighthouse in Cierzo.
Yzan must have brought you back to your family’s lighthouse. Only your aching body tells you that the shipwreck you suffered was not a nightmare.

Visions of monsters fill your fevered dreams, and something stalks you relentlessly though twisted nightmares. You awaken, overwhelmed by a sense of paranoia and terror. You see one of the Vigil crystals up above... How in Elatt’s name did you end up here?

Purple grass surrounds you as you stir from unconsciousness high atop a mountain. Your life-threatening injuries have been bandaged by a hooded man, who silently turns to leave, entering a door along the mountain wall without a backwards glance...
You hover in and out of consciousness for hours, until at last you are able to get back up. Nothing seems to have harmed you while you were out cold. You got lucky…

You wake up to see a butterfly resting on your nose, someplace quiet. As you pull yourself up you notice a trio of ghosts guarding you...yet they soon vanish as if they were never there...It would seem that the Ancestral Memories sent you aid in your time of need.

The smell of ash and cinder wakes you. The wide grin of a travelling Giant merchant greets you as you open your eyes. “Haloo, there, small human! That was a close call, no? You are lucky Silvernose came to your rescue!”

He pats a large backpack. “I have things in here for to prevent you from being in trouble again! My prices are very good, small human!” It would seem that your alliance with the Giants has just saved your life.

You snap awake with a yelp, feeling someone reaching into your various pouches. The hooded man pilfering your belongings jumps to his feet and sprints away at an impressive pace with his two companions.

A quick check confirms the worst. He’s helped himself to a lot of your valuables. You wonder how these criminals knew to find you out here...You sense that someone must have sent them after you, but who?

As you see your life flash before your eyes, a brilliant light blinds you. As your eyes adjust once more, you find yourself laid on the ground someplace safe outdoors. Elatt’s intervention has no doubt saved your life.

Loud screeches startle you awake. You’ve been dragged into a cave, surrounded by the lizards of the marsh, screeching and fighting one another for the right to feast on you! You must flee, if you value your life!

The first thing you notice, as you come to your senses, is that you are in a bed much too large for you. An Ash giant speaks in a rough, incomprehensible language as he tends to you. It would seem your alliance with them has saved your life.

Dull aches wake you from your days-long comatose state. Your injuries and needs have been seen to, and you have been returned to your home in Monsoon. Whoever tended to you left no sign of their identity, nor have they taken payment.

The blood rushes to your head as you awaken upside down, cocooned by massive predatory bugs. With great difficulty, you free yourself and fall to the hive floor. If you do not intend to be dinner tonight, you should make yourself scarce from this place.
Desert bandits pounce on you and tie you up in a sack, before dragging you across the sand dunes. You pass out from the heat and lack of air more than once.

You wake up deep underground, at a bandit’s camp in an old crumbling mine. No doubt they intend to use you as slave labor. You cut the ropes that bind you on a nearby rock and prepare to make your escape!

Hours later you wake up and break free of the bag, only to find yourself in a prison cell surrounded by deadly insects. With great effort, you manage to force the bolts on the door off and stumble out of the cell. It’s time to beat a hasty retreat, before the insects grow hungry!

You’re first aware that an army medic is pouring water into your mouth, then that you’re back at your manor in Levant. The medic declines payment, only saying “It’s been taken care of.” You’ve been out for days, but you’re still mostly in one piece.

A dark, lonely alley greets you as you open your eyes. Someone from the slums of Levant must have found you and brought you to safety. A quick check confirms that they’ve helped themselves to your pouch of money as repayment while they were at it!

Your head aches, resting on rotten driftwood, your body submerged in water. A glance upwards shows only a small speck of light from the top of “The Hole”. You were exceptionally lucky to survive a fall like that.
With great effort, you swim in the murky water until you see a ray of light... You’ve escaped the Fortress of Vendavel, but paid dearly for it.

Days later, you return to your senses, neatly tucked into your bed at your home in Berg. It seems that someone brought you home, and Rissa or one of her attendants nursed you back to health from the brink of death.

The smell of your own sizzling flesh wakes you, in agonizing pain. Burning Men walk nearby, almost oblivious to your presence. You don’t know why they’ve taken you prisoner, but given that they tried to set you on fire...You clearly don’t want to find out.

Something bitter trickles from your mouth as you wake, cocooned by venomous insect creatures. As you free yourself, you can feel their poison coursing through your veins. You may not have much time left before the poison takes you...

Your injured body can take no more, and you pass out from the continued trauma. When your eyes open once more, you are safe at a campsite along the beach. You vow to take better care of yourself in the future.
Your head throbs as you pull yourself up. Gabriella Sullivan gives you a little patronizing wave from nearby. It would seem she saved your life from the criminals who have attacked the Blue Chamber.

You come to, tied to a stake not far from the outpost, left for the beasts and Burning Men to finish off. Fortunately, they ignore you as you free yourself from the stake and arm yourself for another round!

You brace yourself for the killing blow, but it does not come. You crack an eye open to see your foe fleeing at full speed. In your state, you will never catch up to him...It would seem that the one who led the assault on Berg has gotten away.

You wonder what you were thinking, as Cyr lifts you up with one hand. He makes a loud, rousing speech to his people in the giant’s tongue, then he walks right to the gates of his village and hurls you as far as he can. As you hit the ground, the doors slam shut for good.

As Roland’s possessed body approaches for the killing blow, you see him for a moment regain control and hold himself back. You take this as your cue to flee for your life to a safe part of the Necropolis to tend to your wounds.

You awaken in one of the beds in Berg's inn, suffering from a broken rib. The news you hear as you recover is grim indeed, Sagard Battleborn has gone rogue with a large battalion of the army. They will likely be a thorn in everyone’s side for a very long time to come.

Berg falls into a brief period of chaos without it’s Chamberlord, but by the time you can walk again, Gabriella Sullivan has been chosen to be Chamberlady. She seems none too pleased, but life in Berg will go on.

Cheers make you open your eyes through the haze of pain. It would seem the battle is over, and you’ve been dragged to the side with the other injured. While you’re disappointed you missed the end of the fight, as least you’re still alive to tell the tale.

Screams rip from your throat as the corrupted ghosts plunder your life force greedily. Suddenly, a blast of light fills the room, and you see Oliele’s blade cut through your attackers. As you struggle to get up, you see that your friend’s ruined body has been forever changed...

You feel Soeran patching up your injuries as you slowly regain consciousness. A quick glance around confirms that it was a massacre. Not a single one of the rebel priests is still alive. Oliele has completely vanished. Is seems she has forever abandoned the Holy Mission...
You haul yourself to your feet, beaten and bloody. Those thugs from the Blue Chamber Collective beat you to within an inch of your life, then slaughtered the prisoners...Elatt will no doubt be upset.

As the Immaculates pounce on you without mercy, the ground beneath you crumbles, and you fall into darkness. By the time you pull yourself out, your foes seem to have regained their senses and fled the cave. They will no doubt be a danger to Monsoon in the future.

You cough up soot and ash as you wake up. The chamber is caked in dust, and a large hole yawns wide in the wall above you. The attackers seem to have detonated an explosive and left you to take the blame...

You cough up sand as you stir from unconsciousness. You are beaten and bloody, but alive. It would seem that those Blue Chamber Scouts still uphold the tradition of not killing foes unless truly needed, or they mistook your for dead.

You open your eyes in the abandoned docks, inches from death. You have no idea how long you’ve been out, but by now the coup against Levant is likely in full swing. You should hurry if you intend to stop them!
You open your eyes, and can tell by the stench that you’re among a group of corpses. It seems Cyrene mistook you for dead.

The bustle of the Levantine Palace rouses you. From the chatter around you, you can guess that the raid against the Prince was successful, despite your injury. An aide informs you that the Queen wishes to reward your service. You should speak with her once you’ve recovered.

Corrupted Ghosts surge from the Altar, their emergence blasting you away. Oliele drops to the floor, her veins turning a sick glowing green from the Corruption she absorbed. These twisted Ghosts crave your very life! You must defend yourself!
We've all dreamed of being heroes, haven't we? Chosen by destiny, given sacred protection, unrivaled ability...
Divine heroes walk among us, and for a brief moment, you were one of them. You gave your mortal life so that another could live.
Even now, as your vision dims forever, the impact of your deed remains a key part of the history of Aurai.
Even now, as you feel yourself be pulled towards what lies beyond, to join your ancestors...You can't help but feel pride at what you accomplished.
Fortunately, your rest goes without incident and you feel better prepared for the day ahead.
Your rest is interrupted by the faintest of unnatural sounds! You scramble to protect yourself from the ambush!

All my life, I've lived within the safety of Cierzo, spared the brutality of the world outside. But life in Aurai is never that easy. For all the safety that my tribe provides, our laws are harsh. We are judged not as individuals, but as bloodlines.
The failures of my bloodline weigh heavy on me. My grandmother brought ruin to our tribe long ago, bringing a heavy Blood Price upon my family. We’ve paid the debt caused by her actions ever since.

I joined an expedition across the sea with my old friend Yzan, hoping the money made there would be enough to clear my debts. This was a mistake. I’m lucky to still be breathing after our ship hit rocks on the return voyage.
Now, I have no choice but to pick myself up yet again and face the wild, untamed land outside the walls. I must carve out my own future, or die trying.
You collapse, body and spirit broken. Your luck has, at long last, run out. No one is coming to save you. No twist of fortune will protect you.
The harshness of the world outside the walls has claimed yet another victim... You feel your body fall away, as your soul goes to meet your ancestors in the great beyond...

You jolt awake to the sound of cheers and roars of the Calygreys. You’re alone in a cage, with an unfamiliar weapon in your hands, with the sounds of combat just outside. You’ve been taken prisoner in the Calygrey Arena!
The cage door opens! Sounds like it’s your turn to fight for their entertainment!
You wake up being carried back to New Sirocco by a hunting crew. They grumble a little, but they’re clearly happy you’re alive.
They dump you at the town entrance, and the eldest among them urges you to be more careful in the future.

You awake the sound of your own screams and a burning sensation across your entire body. A Drifting Medyse has you in its paralyzing tentacles! All you can do is watch in terror as it injects an egg into your gut before floating away!

By the time you can move again, you can feel the egg moving inside you, preparing to hatch! With desperation you start cutting it out of your body...And manage to rip it out, before trying to staunch the bleeding of your vital organs!

With a sickening pop, the egg hatches on the floor, letting a new Medyse into the world! You scramble for your weapon...But to your confusion, it doesn’t attack you. In fact...It seems perfectly content to just float around you. Words cannot describe how lucky you were to survive the experience...
You stir awake, still in great pain, as Dorion Dumas changes your bandages. “Careful, friend. You’ve been unconscious for days. You’re lucky to be alive!”
You’re frustrated to find that your coinpurse has been pillaged to pay for your treatment, but such is life.
You jolt awake, screaming as you fly through the air before landing in a pair of giant hands. Before you can catch your breath you’re sailing through the air again, to the sound of booming laughter.

A pair of Ash Giants are using you to play “catch!” With no regard for your well-being, they toss you back and forth until one of them misses, and sends you tumbling to the floor. You pull yourself to your feet, considerably worse for wear.

You wake up with your blood rushing to your head, the world upside down. You've been chained up by your legs while an Elder Calygray pokes you with his staff. After grunting softly to a younger one, your captor twacks you with his staff.

Sharp electric pain jolts through you as the staff’s magic activates, much to the younger Calygrey’s awe. Clearly, you’re being used as some sort of involuntary education aid for how Calygrey magic works...

After what feels like hours, you’re released and hurled into a cell, shivering and dispirited by this humiliation. With a grimace of pain, you start to fiddle with the bolts on the door to make your escape!

You violently jerk awake, your mouth open in a silent scream of pain, wrapped up in the toxic tentacles of a Medyse. It is only through pure luck that your agonized spasms dislodge you, and spare you a painful death.

You crawl out of the way, your chest full of the creature’s paralyzing toxins. After hours teetering on the verge of unconsciousness again, you manage to pull yourself to your feet, barely able to breathe.

As you collapse before your foe, you hear the Calygreys cheer your defeat. You’re vaguely aware of one of them dragging you along the ground...When you can finally get up, you find that you’ve been dragged back to the entrance.

A Calygrey at the entrance laughs roughly at you, then points at a chest nearby before he walks away. It seems they’ve kept your old equipment safe for you while you fought. As confusing as it is, kindness is still kindness.
As you stir awake, you feel intense discomfort. For a moment, you worry that you have a fever...But you soon realize you’re lying in a steamy pool of water surrounded by chuckling Ash Giants.
You crawl out of the steaming hot water, feeling almost boiled alive. Clearly, these Giants don’t understand human biology if they had intended to help you.
There are some Travel Rations by the campfire...Perhaps this is a good time to flee this dangerous region and return when you feel more confident...
You fade in and out of consciousness, trying to drag yourself to safety...Your throbbing brain does not recognize your surroundings...Finally, you pass out, unable to go any further.
When at last you awaken, you realize with horror that you have dragged yourself deeper into this dangerous place! You may be in more danger now then before you collapsed!

You throw your hands up, yielding the fight to cheers from the audience. The Arena Master helps you outside the ring and puts a potion into your hands with a chuckle. You sip it gingerly, nursing your wounds and your pride...
You pass a week’s time helping the Workers build up the settlement. The days fly by...

You come to, feeling fangs gripping your leg. Relief floods you as you see a shiny new Beast Golem bearing Sorobor Academy’s crest pulling you along. Surely it’s following a “search and rescue” command and will take you to a medic!

Your heart sinks, full of irritation, as it drags you to a ruined infirmary that has clearly been abandoned for decades, and leaves you by the door. You curse the machine’s idiocy as you haul yourself to your feet.

The Beast Golem drags you and your backpack safely all the way home to Harmattan’s front elevator, before releasing your leg. It ignores your grateful pat on the head, leaping back out into the wild to resume it’s patrol.

An unnatural chill sets in around you as you lay on the ground. Your heart stops in fear as you recognize the beast that slinks towards you. The last thing you see before you black out again is the deformed skull of a Wendigo eyeing you hungrily.
You jolt awake, half encased in ice in the lair of the monstrous cannibal. It takes agonizing hours of work to free yourself. Surely the beast lurks nearby, soon to return to feast on your flesh...
The stench of lake-weeds greet you as you wake, covered head to toe in them. As you sit up, the trio of Veabers that surround you yelp in shock and scatter, scampering for the water.
You have the distinct impression that they had planned to make an adventurer salad out of you. Fortunately, seeing their dinner wake up must have startled them away.

You fade in and out of consciousness, being dragged behind someone...When you finally come to your senses, you realize your hands are bound by crude ropes. ...Bandits must have taken you prisoner while you were out cold...

The outlaws may have taken your backpack and money, but they don’t seem to have taken your equipment. If you want your bag back, you’ll need to search this camp for it, and hope you avoid further trouble.
You open your eyes, finding yourself in a bed, with a Hyena poking you with his nose. A Wolfgang mercenary strides in and grins. “Well, look who’s finally awake! You had a real close call out there!”
You grumble as you feel how much lighter your coinpurse has become, but thank the mercenaries for saving you. They escort you to the edge of their camp and leave you to find your own way home.

The last thing you see, as the Wolfgang pounce on you with a net, is Desy riding full tilt past them with an Immaculate loaded on a Wagon...You may have been caught, but at least the mission has a chance at success.

You open your eyes, chained up in a dark cage. A Wolfgang mercenary walks past and shoves a torch near your face. “Well, looky who’s finally up. You’re lucky we were paid to take you alive. Someone’s already gone and paid your ransom.”

The mercenaries drag you out of their camp and unceremoniously toss you into the dirt outside. As you get back up, you suddenly realize that these thieving cretins have kept your backpack in their camp!

You collapse, desperately trying to fend off the Immaculate’s weapons as they aim for a killing blow. Suddenly, arcing shots of Runic Lightning strike your foes. You black out just as you see Desy leap over your prone form...
You regain consciousness minutes later, with Desy knocking the last Immaculate unconscious. She lets out a sigh of relief and gives you a friendly salute as you haul yourself to your feet.
Laid out flat on your back, you can do nothing but watch as the Butcher of Men approaches, clearly savoring the impending kill. You flinch away as his halberd plunges towards your neck...

The blade strikes the ground, sparing your life. "Be grateful that your life is protected by my need, human. If I ever lay eyes on you again, your life will be mine" The Butcher growls, before striding confidently out of the cave.
As you haul yourself to your knees, you notice the jar of Immaculate blood is cracked and leaking...Hopefully there is still enough to satisfy Victor...

The cozy warmth of your house in Harmattan wakes you from your injured sleep. Someone must have found you and dragged you back home. Given how they did not take payment, they must either be a friend, or a Golem, you suppose.

Clinging to consciousness, you drag yourself through the darkness to safety before blacking out...It’s hours before you have the strength to get to your feet. You don’t quite recognize where you are anymore...

You finally awaken in a cage in a musty cave full of nasty contraptions, with a tube in your arm, draining your blood! You rip it out, and get to work forcing the cell door open...You have no intention of dying here, not today!

When next you open your eyes, the cheerful smells of an Inn in Harmattan greet you. You’ve been out cold for days, and the price of the room hasn’t come cheap, but at least you’ve survived to fight another day...

By the time you regain consciousness, the battle is long over. Your allies have won the day, but the casualties were unbearably high. You drag yourself over to the survivors, dreading to hear who didn’t make it...
Ancient forest of giant trees, with vicious arcane monsters prowling about.
Cold seaside mountains, teeming with wildlife and many bandit clans.
Blazing desert with freezing nights, with giant insects lurking in hives and ruins.
Toxic swamp lit by flowers and fireflies, dotted with dinosaurs nests and glowing undead.

Manual Recipe is used to make potions whose recipe you don’t know yet.
You can retake the Alchemy Kit from the fire, to use on your next campfire.

Manual Recipe is used to make single-ingredient recipes, such as Grilled Meat, or to boil River Water into Clean Water.
To create dishes with multiple ingredients, deploy a Cooking Pot on the campfire.

Manual Recipe is used to make single-ingredient recipes, such as Grilled Meat, or to boil River Water into Clean Water. Or to create a dish with several ingredients, whose recipe you don't know yet!
You can retake the Cooking Pot from the fire, to use on your next campfire.

Manual Recipe allows you to brew concoctions whose recipe you don’t know yet.
Alchemy is used to create consumable items with very potent properties, such as potions that heal instantly.

Manual recipe allows the discovery of new crafting recipes, such as weapons made from monster parts.
Otherwise, survival crafting is used to make essentials items such as Makeshift Torches, if one ever loses his lantern in a cave.

To find a treasure, follow a trail of clues.
First Clue: Find a boat’s cabin, buried in the sand.
Second Clue: Delve into a hornet’s nest, inside a giant forest.
Third Clue: Find a place of claws and fangs, in a swamp’s poison.
Fourth Clue: Go inside the old docks, in the Abrassar desert, to flip a lever.
Claim the treasure inside the old docks.
Donate silver to Pigeoneye, the self-proclaimed leader of Levant’s slums.
Give a second donation to Pidgeoneye It *is* for a good cause.
Pidgeoneye ask for yet more silver. *Surely*, there is a point to all this.
As a reward for my generosity, a shop with rare goods will be opened in the slums, but Pigeoneye yet asks for more silver...
Pigeoneye requires additional silver. I’m sure this final donation will give me access to something in the slums.
Find another ghost manifesting in the Hallowed Marsh. The spectre looked like it wanted to offer something.
Find another ghost. Perhaps this spectre will have something for me.

Sacrifice some of your stamina on the altar.
Find Oliele inside the Corrupted Tomb.
Burn Greasy Fern at the altar on the hill just west of the Marsh’s Vigil. Such plants can be found not far from the altar, or bought.
Find the Corrupted Tomb, in the valley beyond the Ghost Pass dungeon, in the Chersonese’s north-east.
This dungeon contains the source of the barrier blocking access to the corrupted altar. Find that source and disable it.
Open the barrier by helping Myriade find his bones or by smashing his skull.
Go in the altar in the Corrupted Tomb, now that the barrier is down.
Find Myriade’s parts; his left arm, his right and and his left leg. Bring the parts to his body.

Give enough coin to Lockwell, to free Oliele.
Rescue Oliele from a cellar, in a cluster of ruins on the Pilgrim Road.
Tell Ellinara, in Monsoon, about Oliele’s freedom.
Ask around Monsoon for clues about Oliele’s location.

Ellinara, in the city of Monsoon, will have a task for you in 3 days.

Meet with Oliele in the slums of Levant, in the southern part of the city.
That city is in the Abrassar desert, accessible by passing through the Enmerkar Forest first.

Report to Cardinal Bourlamaque that Levant’s agents were slain, then prepare to end the war.

Search around the city for someone with a way to enter Levant.

Enjoy the peace you helped to create.
Your body grows weak as time passes. Eventually, you will truly die after being defeated.
Give Horror Chitin, a Tribal Favor or a Coralhorn Bow to Gabriella, in Berg. The temple in Enmerkar’s south-west contains horrors.

Wait 24 hours for the new equipment to be crafted.
Return to New Sirocco’s blacksmith to collect your equipment.
A messenger is waiting for you at the Inn in Berg.
Travel to the Caldera Region, from the South of Enmerkar.

- At least two resource production buildings.

Your initial supplies will only last 150 days. Workers will abandon the settlement after that time, slowing construction speed...Dorion may find a way for you to help, once Building Tasks are done.

Magma Forges will be installed in about 150 days. Josef may have a more efficient solution you can help with, once construction is done!
Speak with Josef Dumas about his improved forge idea.

Bring a Large Chalcedony Stone (Backpack) to the Charging Station inside the depths of the Eldest Brother Volcano.
Then, bring the Charged Forge Stone back to Josef in New Sirocco.
(The Volcano can be accessed by going through Old Sirocco)

a) Sabotage the deactivated Beast Golem at the mine tunnel entrance inside the Ruined Golem Warehouse (Downtown area of Antique Plateau).
b) Sabotage the 3 Explosive Detonators in the Wolfgang Mercenary camp in the West of Antique Plateau.
c) Sabotage the Troglodyte Tunnel inside the Destroyed Test Chambers (Mana Lake area of Antique Plateau).
d) Get help from Hugo Lockwell in the city of Harmattan.
e) Get help from Sekiguchi Meiko in the city of Harmattan.

An important debate will take place in 20 days in the Military District, inside the city of Harmattan. Do not be late.

[Optional] Ask for help from Joliette Montgomery.

[Optional] Ask for help from Samuel Laurent.
Retrieve 3 Mana Filters (Blue curved pipe pieces) from the Compromised Mana Transfer Station.
You are late for the important debate! Go to the Military District, inside the city of Harmattan.

The battle is over. Speak with the Runed Immaculate in Old Harmattan.
The battle is over. Speak with the surviving Wolfgang Mercenary in Old Harmattan.
The battle is over. Speak with the surviving Immaculate in Old Harmattan.
Someone called the “Forge Master” is threatening harm to Harmattan City in 60 days...
You have touched a strange Rune inside a Golem...You can now enter the ruins near the Ancient Bunker, the Ruined Hippodrome, and the Ancient Turbine.
You have delayed the Forge Master’s plans! You have a fresh time limit of 60 days.
You have delayed the Forge Master’s plans a second time! You have a fresh time limit of 60 days.
Find 4 Gemstone Keys to activate the Large Console inside the Forgotten Research Laboratory.
Find the “Forge Master” and defeat him!
Destroy the “Forge Master’s” Phylactery, or return in a few days to fight him again. You have a fresh time limit of 60 days.
Deal with the dying Forge Master.
Speak to Headmaster Raul Salaberry for your reward.
Harmattan had to fight the Forge Master's Golems themselves. The Quest's rewards have been decreased
There should be a way to delay the Forge Master and gain more time...
Someone called the “Forge Master” is threatening harm to Harmattan City in 100 days...
Show the evidence obtained from Dead Roots to either of the two Provosts, or to Headmaster Salaberry in Harmattan.
Your body has needs. Eat food, drink water and sleep in a tent or inn to satisfy them. You receive penalties if your needs are not met. Inns will take care of all your needs for you.
Blocking prevents all damage from melee attacks, but costs stamina. Shields can block arrows and the like, but you cannot block magical blasts.
Dodging allows you to temporarily evade any type of attack. Note that most backpacks, when equipped, slow down your dodge.
You can drop and pick up backpacks with a button or by using the inventory menu. Your compass will point to your last-used backpack, making it easier to find back.
You can hang a lantern from most backpacks, providing light while freeing your hands. Simply place a lantern in your backpack inventory, lighting the lantern if it is not lit already.
Equipment loses durability with use, becoming weaker. Items can be repaired while you rest in a tent. “Broken” items can still be used.
Waterskins are the only way to store water. They are essential for explorers, and having multiple waterskins may be useful.
Quickslotting your items, weapons and skills is the best way to use them quickly in combat. You only have 8 quickslots, so choose wisely.
Eating raw food and drinking unboiled water can give you diseases. Certain potions and teas can cure diseases, though recovering from a disease takes time.
You can light a campfire with a Flint and Steel or certain fire spells. Note that campfires don’t run out of fuel, so they don’t go out.
You have very limited inventory space, even with a backpack. Drop less useful items and don’t pick up everything you find, as too much weight will slow you down.
Food rots with time. Eat or cook your food before it goes to waste!
You can be attacked while you rest in a tent. Either find a safe spot or spend time on guard duty to lower the chances of ambush.
You can craft many useful items with just your hands. This survival crafting menu is available at all times in your player menu.
When your health or stamina decreases (e.g. during combat), your max health or stamina decreases. Sleep in a tent or an inn to recover your maximum health and stamina.
You can move stealthily by crouching. Having a lit torch or lantern will make you very visible nonetheless. Put out your light when sneaking!
You can learn new crafting recipes by finding a recipe scroll. Or you could experiment in Manual Recipe mode, where you can use any ingredients together.
You need a cooking pot deployed on a lit campfire to cook recipes with more than one ingredient. Boiling water or grilling raw meat only needs a lit campfire.
To travel from one exterior region to another, you must use Travel Rations. They can be bought from merchants or crafted, with a cooking pot, from salt and various food types.
The weather often gets dangerously cold or hot. Keep your temperature neutral with appropriate clothes, certain types of food or campfires.
Bows are the most basic way to make ranged attacks. You can zoom in and shoot at distant foes. Note that arrows must be equipped before they can be shot.
In addition to finding better equipment, you get stronger by using Trainers found in each city. There, you can buy active skills and passive buffs.
You can store any item you don’t want in the Stash chests found in homes. Note that the currency, silver coins, have weight!
Starting characters can’t use magic. Mana must first be unlocked at a Ley Line.
Wild beasts drop body parts. Powerful weapons and potions can be crafted from these, or can be used to arm powerful traps.
Each tree has an unlimited amount of wood that can be gathered. Wood is commonly used in survival crafting, notably to make campfires.
Gathering plants and mushrooms is the most basic way to find food. They will rot more slowly after being cooked.
The Journal is a menu tab used to track your next tasks.
Pay close attention to the alerts displayed on the bottom left. They will warn you when you’re hungry, your weapon is damaged, etc.
The status menu shows details related to your equipment or what effects are currently affecting you.
Many places are very dark, requiring lanterns or torches to light your way. Such objects burn out over time. Use the survival crafting menu to combine the oil item and a lantern to refill it.
You can play along with people in your friend list! Try the multiplayer, either in split screen or online.
You can lock on enemies. You will then be able to better target that enemy, especially with ranged weapons or skills.
Hitting enemies, especially with heavier weapons, will knock them back and cancel their attacks. However, they can knock you down too.
To save fuel, you can close and light lanterns or torches. Note that light sources make you more visible to enemies while they are lit.
Look at the Maps, as exterior regions are huge. Important landmarks have icons, and hovering your cursor on them will show their names.
Melee weapons can make normal attacks and special attacks. Which special attack will be made depends on the number of normal attacks you just performed.
Specific tools are needed to gather some resources. Mineral ores require a mining pick and fishing spots need a fishing harpoon.
Two-handed weapons deal more damage and have more reach than smaller weapons. However, you won’t be able to wield a shield, a lantern or a special trinket in your off-hand.
You start the game with a few skills, like the Kick. You also know several useful survival crafting recipes.
You can de-craft most weapons and armors. Place only that item in Manual Recipe (of survival crafting) and accept, turning the item into basic resources like iron or palladium scraps.
Traps are very useful. You must deploy a trap trigger (like a Tripwire Trap) on the ground, then place a compatible object in it (like spikes or weapons).
Heavier armor offers greater protection from physical damage, but slows down your movement and makes every action consume more stamina.
Each city has several merchants, either directly outside or inside buildings. They will sell food, equipment and crafting recipes, in addition to selling goods related to their city’s specialties.
The absolute basic gear for an explorer is a backpack containing a waterskin, food, bandages, antidotes, a tent, and firewood. Things like cooking pots and traps help greatly too.
Ask innkeepers found in each city for information or directions. Guards can also provide advice.
